speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: SCENE I. Windsor. Before PAGE's house.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Enter SHALLOW, SLENDER, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Sir Hugh, persuade me not; I will make a Star-

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: chamber matter of it: if he were twenty Sir John

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Falstaffs, he shall not abuse Robert Shallow, esquire.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: In the county of Gloucester, justice of peace and

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: 'Coram.'

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Ay, cousin Slender, and 'Custalourum.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, and 'Rato-lorum' too; and a gentleman born,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: master parson; who writes himself 'Armigero,' in any

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: bill, warrant, quittance, or obligation, 'Armigero.'

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Ay, that I do; and have done any time these three

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: hundred years.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: All his successors gone before him hath done't; and

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: all his ancestors that come after him may: they may

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: give the dozen white luces in their coat.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: It is an old coat.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: The dozen white louses do become an old coat well;

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: it agrees well, passant; it is a familiar beast to

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: man, and signifies love.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: The luce is the fresh fish; the salt fish is an old coat.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I may quarter, coz.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: You may, by marrying.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is marring indeed, if he quarter it.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Not a whit.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Yes, py'r lady; if he has a quarter of your coat,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: there is but three skirts for yourself, in my

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: simple conjectures: but that is all one. If Sir

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: John Falstaff have committed disparagements unto

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: you, I am of the church, and will be glad to do my

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: benevolence to make atonements and compremises

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: between you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: The council shall bear it; it is a riot.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is not meet the council hear a riot; there is no

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: fear of Got in a riot: the council, look you, shall

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: desire to hear the fear of Got, and not to hear a

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: riot; take your vizaments in that.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Ha! o' my life, if I were young again, the sword

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: should end it.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is petter that friends is the sword, and end it:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and there is also another device in my prain, which

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: peradventure prings goot discretions with it: there

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: is Anne Page, which is daughter to Master Thomas

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Page, which is pretty virginity.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Mistress Anne Page? She has brown hair, and speaks

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: small like a woman.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is that fery person for all the orld, as just as

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: you will desire; and seven hundred pounds of moneys,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and gold and silver, is her grandsire upon his

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: death's-bed--Got deliver to a joyful resurrections!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: --give, when she is able to overtake seventeen years

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: old: it were a goot motion if we leave our pribbles

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and prabbles, and desire a marriage between Master

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Abraham and Mistress Anne Page.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Did her grandsire leave her seven hundred pound?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Ay, and her father is make her a petter penny.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I know the young gentlewoman; she has good gifts.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Seven hundred pounds and possibilities is goot gifts.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Well, let us see honest Master Page. Is Falstaff there?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Shall I tell you a lie? I do despise a liar as I do

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: despise one that is false, or as I despise one that

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: is not true. The knight, Sir John, is there; and, I

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: beseech you, be ruled by your well-willers. I will

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: peat the door for Master Page.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Knocks

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: What, hoa! Got pless your house here!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: [Within]  Who's there?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter PAGE

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Here is Got's plessing, and your friend, and Justice

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Shallow; and here young Master Slender, that

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: peradventures shall tell you another tale, if

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: matters grow to your likings.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I am glad to see your worships well.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I thank you for my venison, Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Master Page, I am glad to see you: much good do it

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: your good heart! I wished your venison better; it

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: was ill killed. How doth good Mistress Page?--and I

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: thank you always with my heart, la! with my heart.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Sir, I thank you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Sir, I thank you; by yea and no, I do.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I am glad to see you, good Master Slender.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: How does your fallow greyhound, sir? I heard say he

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: was outrun on Cotsall.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: It could not be judged, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: You'll not confess, you'll not confess.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: That he will not. 'Tis your fault, 'tis your fault;

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: 'tis a good dog.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: A cur, sir.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Sir, he's a good dog, and a fair dog: can there be

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: more said? he is good and fair. Is Sir John

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Falstaff here?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Sir, he is within; and I would I could do a good

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: office between you.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is spoke as a Christians ought to speak.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: He hath wronged me, Master Page.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Sir, he doth in some sort confess it.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: If it be confessed, it is not redress'd: is not that

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: so, Master Page? He hath wronged me; indeed he

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: hath, at a word, he hath, believe me: Robert

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Shallow, esquire, saith, he is wronged.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Here comes Sir John.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF, BARDOLPH, NYM, and PISTOL

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, Master Shallow, you'll complain of me to the king?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Knight, you have beaten my men, killed my deer, and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: broke open my lodge.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: But not kissed your keeper's daughter?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Tut, a pin! this shall be answered.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I will answer it straight; I have done all this.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: That is now answered.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: The council shall know this.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: 'Twere better for you if it were known in counsel:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: you'll be laughed at.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pauca verba, Sir John; goot worts.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Good worts! good cabbage. Slender, I broke your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: head: what matter have you against me?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Marry, sir, I have matter in my head against you;

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: and against your cony-catching rascals, Bardolph,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Nym, and Pistol.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: You Banbury cheese!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, it is no matter.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: How now, Mephostophilus!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, it is no matter.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Slice, I say! pauca, pauca: slice! that's my humour.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Where's Simple, my man? Can you tell, cousin?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Peace, I pray you. Now let us understand. There is

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: three umpires in this matter, as I understand; that

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: is, Master Page, fidelicet Master Page; and there is

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: myself, fidelicet myself; and the three party is,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: lastly and finally, mine host of the Garter.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: We three, to hear it and end it between them.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Fery goot: I will make a prief of it in my note-

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: book; and we will afterwards ork upon the cause with

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: as great discreetly as we can.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Pistol!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: He hears with ears.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: The tevil and his tam! what phrase is this, 'He

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: hears with ear'? why, it is affectations.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Pistol, did you pick Master Slender's purse?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, by these gloves, did he, or I would I might

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: never come in mine own great chamber again else, of

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: seven groats in mill-sixpences, and two Edward

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: shovel-boards, that cost me two shilling and two

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: pence apiece of Yead Miller, by these gloves.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Is this true, Pistol?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: No; it is false, if it is a pick-purse.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Ha, thou mountain-foreigner! Sir John and Master mine,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: I combat challenge of this latten bilbo.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Word of denial in thy labras here!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Word of denial: froth and scum, thou liest!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: By these gloves, then, 'twas he.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Be avised, sir, and pass good humours: I will say

speaker: NYM
text_entry: 'marry trap' with you, if you run the nuthook's

speaker: NYM
text_entry: humour on me; that is the very note of it.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: By this hat, then, he in the red face had it; for

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: though I cannot remember what I did when you made me

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: drunk, yet I am not altogether an ass.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What say you, Scarlet and John?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Why, sir, for my part I say the gentleman had drunk

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: himself out of his five sentences.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is his five senses: fie, what the ignorance is!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: And being fap, sir, was, as they say, cashiered; and

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: so conclusions passed the careires.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, you spake in Latin then too; but 'tis no

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: matter: I'll ne'er be drunk whilst I live again,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: but in honest, civil, godly company, for this trick:

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: if I be drunk, I'll be drunk with those that have

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: the fear of God, and not with drunken knaves.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: So Got udge me, that is a virtuous mind.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You hear all these matters denied, gentlemen; you hear it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter ANNE PAGE, with wine; MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE, following

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Nay, daughter, carry the wine in; we'll drink within.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exit ANNE PAGE

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: O heaven! this is Mistress Anne Page.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Mistress Ford!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford, by my troth, you are very well met:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: by your leave, good mistress.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Kisses her

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Wife, bid these gentlemen welcome. Come, we have a

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: hot venison pasty to dinner: come, gentlemen, I hope

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: we shall drink down all unkindness.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt all except SHALLOW, SLENDER, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I had rather than forty shillings I had my Book of

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Songs and Sonnets here.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Enter SIMPLE

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: How now, Simple! where have you been? I must wait

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: on myself, must I? You have not the Book of Riddles

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: about you, have you?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Book of Riddles! why, did you not lend it to Alice

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Shortcake upon All-hallowmas last, a fortnight

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: afore Michaelmas?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Come, coz; come, coz; we stay for you. A word with

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: you, coz; marry, this, coz: there is, as 'twere, a

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: tender, a kind of tender, made afar off by Sir Hugh

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: here. Do you understand me?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, sir, you shall find me reasonable; if it be so,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I shall do that that is reason.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Nay, but understand me.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: So I do, sir.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Give ear to his motions, Master Slender: I will

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: description the matter to you, if you be capacity of it.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Nay, I will do as my cousin Shallow says: I pray

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: you, pardon me; he's a justice of peace in his

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: country, simple though I stand here.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: But that is not the question: the question is

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: concerning your marriage.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Ay, there's the point, sir.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Marry, is it; the very point of it; to Mistress Anne Page.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Why, if it be so, I will marry her upon any

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: reasonable demands.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: But can you affection the 'oman? Let us command to

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: know that of your mouth or of your lips; for divers

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: philosophers hold that the lips is parcel of the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: mouth. Therefore, precisely, can you carry your

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: good will to the maid?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Cousin Abraham Slender, can you love her?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I hope, sir, I will do as it shall become one that

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: would do reason.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Nay, Got's lords and his ladies! you must speak

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: possitable, if you can carry her your desires

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: towards her.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: That you must. Will you, upon good dowry, marry her?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I will do a greater thing than that, upon your

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: request, cousin, in any reason.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Nay, conceive me, conceive me, sweet coz: what I do

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: is to pleasure you, coz. Can you love the maid?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I will marry her, sir, at your request: but if there

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: be no great love in the beginning, yet heaven may

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: decrease it upon better acquaintance, when we are

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: married and have more occasion to know one another;

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I hope, upon familiarity will grow more contempt:

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: but if you say, 'Marry her,' I will marry her; that

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I am freely dissolved, and dissolutely.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is a fery discretion answer; save the fall is in

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: the ort 'dissolutely:' the ort is, according to our

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: meaning, 'resolutely:' his meaning is good.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Ay, I think my cousin meant well.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, or else I would I might be hanged, la!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Here comes fair Mistress Anne.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Re-enter ANNE PAGE

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Would I were young for your sake, Mistress Anne!

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: The dinner is on the table; my father desires your

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: worships' company.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I will wait on him, fair Mistress Anne.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Od's plessed will! I will not be absence at the grace.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt SHALLOW and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Will't please your worship to come in, sir?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: No, I thank you, forsooth, heartily; I am very well.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: The dinner attends you, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I am not a-hungry, I thank you, forsooth. Go,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: sirrah, for all you are my man, go wait upon my

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: cousin Shallow.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Exit SIMPLE

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: A justice of peace sometimes may be beholding to his

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: friend for a man. I keep but three men and a boy

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: yet, till my mother be dead: but what though? Yet I

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: live like a poor gentleman born.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: I may not go in without your worship: they will not

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: sit till you come.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I' faith, I'll eat nothing; I thank you as much as

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: though I did.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: I pray you, sir, walk in.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I had rather walk here, I thank you. I bruised

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: my shin th' other day with playing at sword and

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: dagger with a master of fence; three veneys for a

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: dish of stewed prunes; and, by my troth, I cannot

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: abide the smell of hot meat since. Why do your

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: dogs bark so? be there bears i' the town?

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: I think there are, sir; I heard them talked of.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I love the sport well but I shall as soon quarrel at

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: it as any man in England. You are afraid, if you see

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: the bear loose, are you not?

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Ay, indeed, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: That's meat and drink to me, now. I have seen

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Sackerson loose twenty times, and have taken him by

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: the chain; but, I warrant you, the women have so

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: cried and shrieked at it, that it passed: but women,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: indeed, cannot abide 'em; they are very ill-favored

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: rough things.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Re-enter PAGE

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Come, gentle Master Slender, come; we stay for you.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I'll eat nothing, I thank you, sir.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: By cock and pie, you shall not choose, sir! come, come.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Nay, pray you, lead the way.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Come on, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Mistress Anne, yourself shall go first.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Not I, sir; pray you, keep on.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I'll rather be unmannerly than troublesome.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: You do yourself wrong, indeed, la!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: SCENE II. The same.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS and SIMPLE

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Go your ways, and ask of Doctor Caius' house which

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: is the way: and there dwells one Mistress Quickly,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: which is in the manner of his nurse, or his dry

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: nurse, or his cook, or his laundry, his washer, and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: his wringer.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Well, sir.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Nay, it is petter yet. Give her this letter; for it

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: is a 'oman that altogether's acquaintance with

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Mistress Anne Page: and the letter is, to desire

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and require her to solicit your master's desires to

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Mistress Anne Page. I pray you, be gone: I will

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: make an end of my dinner; there's pippins and cheese to come.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF, Host, BARDOLPH, NYM, PISTOL, and ROBIN

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mine host of the Garter!

speaker: Host
text_entry: What says my bully-rook? speak scholarly and wisely.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Truly, mine host, I must turn away some of my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: followers.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Discard, bully Hercules; cashier: let them wag; trot, trot.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I sit at ten pounds a week.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Thou'rt an emperor, Caesar, Keisar, and Pheezar. I

speaker: Host
text_entry: will entertain Bardolph; he shall draw, he shall

speaker: Host
text_entry: tap: said I well, bully Hector?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Do so, good mine host.

speaker: Host
text_entry: I have spoke; let him follow.

speaker: Host
text_entry: To BARDOLPH

speaker: Host
text_entry: Let me see thee froth and lime: I am at a word; follow.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Bardolph, follow him. A tapster is a good trade:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: an old cloak makes a new jerkin; a withered

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: serving-man a fresh tapster. Go; adieu.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: It is a life that I have desired: I will thrive.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: O base Hungarian wight! wilt thou the spigot wield?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Exit BARDOLPH

speaker: NYM
text_entry: He was gotten in drink: is not the humour conceited?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I am glad I am so acquit of this tinderbox: his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thefts were too open; his filching was like an

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: unskilful singer; he kept not time.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: The good humour is to steal at a minute's rest.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: 'Convey,' the wise it call. 'Steal!' foh! a fico

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: for the phrase!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, sirs, I am almost out at heels.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Why, then, let kibes ensue.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: There is no remedy; I must cony-catch; I must shift.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Young ravens must have food.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Which of you know Ford of this town?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: I ken the wight: he is of substance good.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: My honest lads, I will tell you what I am about.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Two yards, and more.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No quips now, Pistol! Indeed, I am in the waist two

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: yards about; but I am now about no waste; I am about

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thrift. Briefly, I do mean to make love to Ford's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: wife: I spy entertainment in her; she discourses,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: she carves, she gives the leer of invitation: I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: can construe the action of her familiar style; and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the hardest voice of her behavior, to be Englished

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rightly, is, 'I am Sir John Falstaff's.'

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: He hath studied her will, and translated her will,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: out of honesty into English.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: The anchor is deep: will that humour pass?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, the report goes she has all the rule of her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: husband's purse: he hath a legion of angels.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: As many devils entertain; and 'To her, boy,' say I.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: The humour rises; it is good: humour me the angels.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I have writ me here a letter to her: and here

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: another to Page's wife, who even now gave me good

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: eyes too, examined my parts with most judicious

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: oeillades; sometimes the beam of her view gilded my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: foot, sometimes my portly belly.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Then did the sun on dunghill shine.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: I thank thee for that humour.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O, she did so course o'er my exteriors with such a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: greedy intention, that the appetite of her eye did

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: seem to scorch me up like a burning-glass! Here's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: another letter to her: she bears the purse too; she

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: is a region in Guiana, all gold and bounty. I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: be cheater to them both, and they shall be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: exchequers to me; they shall be my East and West

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Indies, and I will trade to them both. Go bear thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: this letter to Mistress Page; and thou this to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford: we will thrive, lads, we will thrive.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Shall I Sir Pandarus of Troy become,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: And by my side wear steel? then, Lucifer take all!

speaker: NYM
text_entry: I will run no base humour: here, take the

speaker: NYM
text_entry: humour-letter: I will keep the havior of reputation.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: [To ROBIN]  Hold, sirrah, bear you these letters tightly;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sail like my pinnace to these golden shores.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Rogues, hence, avaunt! vanish like hailstones, go;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Trudge, plod away o' the hoof; seek shelter, pack!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Falstaff will learn the humour of the age,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: French thrift, you rogues; myself and skirted page.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exeunt FALSTAFF and ROBIN

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Let vultures gripe thy guts! for gourd and fullam holds,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: And high and low beguiles the rich and poor:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Tester I'll have in pouch when thou shalt lack,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Base Phrygian Turk!

speaker: NYM
text_entry: I have operations which be humours of revenge.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Wilt thou revenge?

speaker: NYM
text_entry: By welkin and her star!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: With wit or steel?

speaker: NYM
text_entry: With both the humours, I:

speaker: NYM
text_entry: I will discuss the humour of this love to Page.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: And I to Ford shall eke unfold

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: How Falstaff, varlet vile,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: His dove will prove, his gold will hold,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: And his soft couch defile.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: My humour shall not cool: I will incense Page to

speaker: NYM
text_entry: deal with poison; I will possess him with

speaker: NYM
text_entry: yellowness, for the revolt of mine is dangerous:

speaker: NYM
text_entry: that is my true humour.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Thou art the Mars of malecontents: I second thee; troop on.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: SCENE IV. A room in DOCTOR CAIUS' house.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY, SIMPLE, and RUGBY

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: What, John Rugby! I pray thee, go to the casement,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: and see if you can see my master, Master Doctor

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Caius, coming. If he do, i' faith, and find any

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: body in the house, here will be an old abusing of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: God's patience and the king's English.

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: I'll go watch.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Go; and we'll have a posset for't soon at night, in

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: faith, at the latter end of a sea-coal fire.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Exit RUGBY

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: An honest, willing, kind fellow, as ever servant

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: shall come in house withal, and, I warrant you, no

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: tell-tale nor no breed-bate: his worst fault is,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: that he is given to prayer; he is something peevish

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: that way: but nobody but has his fault; but let

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: that pass. Peter Simple, you say your name is?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Ay, for fault of a better.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And Master Slender's your master?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Ay, forsooth.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Does he not wear a great round beard, like a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: glover's paring-knife?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: No, forsooth: he hath but a little wee face, with a

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: little yellow beard, a Cain-coloured beard.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: A softly-sprighted man, is he not?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Ay, forsooth: but he is as tall a man of his hands

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: as any is between this and his head; he hath fought

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: with a warrener.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: How say you? O, I should remember him: does he not

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: hold up his head, as it were, and strut in his gait?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Yes, indeed, does he.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Well, heaven send Anne Page no worse fortune! Tell

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Master Parson Evans I will do what I can for your

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: master: Anne is a good girl, and I wish--

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Re-enter RUGBY

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: Out, alas! here comes my master.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: We shall all be shent. Run in here, good young man;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: go into this closet: he will not stay long.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Shuts SIMPLE in the closet

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: What, John Rugby! John! what, John, I say!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Go, John, go inquire for my master; I doubt

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: he be not well, that he comes not home.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Singing

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And down, down, adown-a,  and c.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter DOCTOR CAIUS

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vat is you sing? I do not like des toys. Pray you,

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: go and vetch me in my closet un boitier vert, a box,

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: a green-a box: do intend vat I speak? a green-a box.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Ay, forsooth; I'll fetch it you.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Aside

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: I am glad he went not in himself: if he had found

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: the young man, he would have been horn-mad.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Fe, fe, fe, fe! ma foi, il fait fort chaud. Je

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: m'en vais a la cour--la grande affaire.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Is it this, sir?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Oui; mette le au mon pocket: depeche, quickly. Vere

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: is dat knave Rugby?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: What, John Rugby! John!

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: Here, sir!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: You are John Rugby, and you are Jack Rugby. Come,

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: take-a your rapier, and come after my heel to the court.

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: 'Tis ready, sir, here in the porch.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By my trot, I tarry too long. Od's me!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Qu'ai-j'oublie! dere is some simples in my closet,

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: dat I vill not for the varld I shall leave behind.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Ay me, he'll find the young man here, and be mad!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: O diable, diable! vat is in my closet? Villain! larron!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Pulling SIMPLE out

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Rugby, my rapier!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Good master, be content.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Wherefore shall I be content-a?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: The young man is an honest man.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: What shall de honest man do in my closet? dere is

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: no honest man dat shall come in my closet.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: I beseech you, be not so phlegmatic. Hear the truth

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: of it: he came of an errand to me from Parson Hugh.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vell.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Ay, forsooth; to desire her to--

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Peace, I pray you.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Peace-a your tongue. Speak-a your tale.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: To desire this honest gentlewoman, your maid, to

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: speak a good word to Mistress Anne Page for my

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: master in the way of marriage.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: This is all, indeed, la! but I'll ne'er put my

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: finger in the fire, and need not.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Sir Hugh send-a you? Rugby, baille me some paper.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Tarry you a little-a while.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Writes

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: [Aside to SIMPLE]  I am glad he is so quiet: if he

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: had been thoroughly moved, you should have heard him

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: so loud and so melancholy. But notwithstanding,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: man, I'll do you your master what good I can: and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: the very yea and the no is, the French doctor, my

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: master,--I may call him my master, look you, for I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: keep his house; and I wash, wring, brew, bake,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: scour, dress meat and drink, make the beds and do

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: all myself,--

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: [Aside to MISTRESS QUICKLY]  'Tis a great charge to

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: come under one body's hand.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: [Aside to SIMPLE]  Are you avised o' that? you

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: shall find it a great charge: and to be up early

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: and down late; but notwithstanding,--to tell you in

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: your ear; I would have no words of it,--my master

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: himself is in love with Mistress Anne Page: but

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: notwithstanding that, I know Anne's mind,--that's

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: neither here nor there.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: You jack'nape, give-a this letter to Sir Hugh; by

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: gar, it is a shallenge: I will cut his troat in dee

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: park; and I will teach a scurvy jack-a-nape priest

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: to meddle or make. You may be gone; it is not good

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: you tarry here. By gar, I will cut all his two

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: stones; by gar, he shall not have a stone to throw

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: at his dog:

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exit SIMPLE

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Alas, he speaks but for his friend.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: It is no matter-a ver dat: do not you tell-a me

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: dat I shall have Anne Page for myself? By gar, I

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: vill kill de Jack priest; and I have appointed mine

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: host of de Jarteer to measure our weapon. By gar, I

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: will myself have Anne Page.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Sir, the maid loves you, and all shall be well. We

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: must give folks leave to prate: what, the good-jer!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Rugby, come to the court with me. By gar, if I have

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: not Anne Page, I shall turn your head out of my

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: door. Follow my heels, Rugby.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exeunt DOCTOR CAIUS and RUGBY

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: You shall have An fool's-head of your own. No, I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: know Anne's mind for that: never a woman in Windsor

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: knows more of Anne's mind than I do; nor can do more

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: than I do with her, I thank heaven.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: [Within]  Who's within there? ho!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Who's there, I trow! Come near the house, I pray you.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter FENTON

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: How now, good woman? how dost thou?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: The better that it pleases your good worship to ask.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: What news? how does pretty Mistress Anne?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: In truth, sir, and she is pretty, and honest, and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: gentle; and one that is your friend, I can tell you

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: that by the way; I praise heaven for it.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Shall I do any good, thinkest thou? shall I not lose my suit?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Troth, sir, all is in his hands above: but

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: notwithstanding, Master Fenton, I'll be sworn on a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: book, she loves you. Have not your worship a wart

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: above your eye?

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Yes, marry, have I; what of that?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Well, thereby hangs a tale: good faith, it is such

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: another Nan; but, I detest, an honest maid as ever

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: broke bread: we had an hour's talk of that wart. I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: shall never laugh but in that maid's company! But

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: indeed she is given too much to allicholy and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: musing: but for you--well, go to.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Well, I shall see her to-day. Hold, there's money

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: for thee; let me have thy voice in my behalf: if

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: thou seest her before me, commend me.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Will I? i'faith, that we will; and I will tell your

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: worship more of the wart the next time we have

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: confidence; and of other wooers.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Well, farewell; I am in great haste now.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Farewell to your worship.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Exit FENTON

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Truly, an honest gentleman: but Anne loves him not;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: for I know Anne's mind as well as another does. Out

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: upon't! what have I forgot?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: SCENE I. Before PAGE'S house.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS PAGE, with a letter

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What, have I scaped love-letters in the holiday-

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: time of my beauty, and am I now a subject for them?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Let me see.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: 'Ask me no reason why I love you; for though

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Love use Reason for his physician, he admits him

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: not for his counsellor. You are not young, no more

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: am I; go to then, there's sympathy: you are merry,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: so am I; ha, ha! then there's more sympathy: you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: love sack, and so do I; would you desire better

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: sympathy? Let it suffice thee, Mistress Page,--at

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: the least, if the love of soldier can suffice,--

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: that I love thee. I will not say, pity me; 'tis

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: not a soldier-like phrase: but I say, love me. By me,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Thine own true knight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: By day or night,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Or any kind of light,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: With all his might

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: For thee to fight,    JOHN FALSTAFF'

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What a Herod of Jewry is this! O wicked

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: world! One that is well-nigh worn to pieces with

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: age to show himself a young gallant! What an

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: unweighed behavior hath this Flemish drunkard

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: picked--with the devil's name!--out of my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: conversation, that he dares in this manner assay me?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, he hath not been thrice in my company! What

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: should I say to him? I was then frugal of my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: mirth: Heaven forgive me! Why, I'll exhibit a bill

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: in the parliament for the putting down of men. How

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: shall I be revenged on him? for revenged I will be,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: as sure as his guts are made of puddings.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS FORD

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Mistress Page! trust me, I was going to your house.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And, trust me, I was coming to you. You look very

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: ill.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, I'll ne'er believe that; I have to show to the contrary.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Faith, but you do, in my mind.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Well, I do then; yet I say I could show you to the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: contrary. O Mistress Page, give me some counsel!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What's the matter, woman?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: O woman, if it were not for one trifling respect, I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: could come to such honour!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Hang the trifle, woman! take the honour. What is

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: it? dispense with trifles; what is it?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: If I would but go to hell for an eternal moment or so,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I could be knighted.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What? thou liest! Sir Alice Ford! These knights

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: will hack; and so thou shouldst not alter the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: article of thy gentry.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: We burn daylight: here, read, read; perceive how I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: might be knighted. I shall think the worse of fat

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: men, as long as I have an eye to make difference of

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: men's liking: and yet he would not swear; praised

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: women's modesty; and gave such orderly and

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: well-behaved reproof to all uncomeliness, that I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: would have sworn his disposition would have gone to

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: the truth of his words; but they do no more adhere

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: and keep place together than the Hundredth Psalm to

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: the tune of 'Green Sleeves.' What tempest, I trow,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: threw this whale, with so many tuns of oil in his

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: belly, ashore at Windsor? How shall I be revenged

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: on him? I think the best way were to entertain him

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: with hope, till the wicked fire of lust have melted

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: him in his own grease. Did you ever hear the like?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Letter for letter, but that the name of Page and

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Ford differs! To thy great comfort in this mystery

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: of ill opinions, here's the twin-brother of thy

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: letter: but let thine inherit first; for, I

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: protest, mine never shall. I warrant he hath a

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: thousand of these letters, writ with blank space for

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: different names--sure, more,--and these are of the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: second edition: he will print them, out of doubt;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: for he cares not what he puts into the press, when

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: he would put us two. I had rather be a giantess,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and lie under Mount Pelion. Well, I will find you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: twenty lascivious turtles ere one chaste man.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, this is the very same; the very hand, the very

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: words. What doth he think of us?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Nay, I know not: it makes me almost ready to

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: wrangle with mine own honesty. I'll entertain

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: myself like one that I am not acquainted withal;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: for, sure, unless he know some strain in me, that I

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: know not myself, he would never have boarded me in this fury.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: 'Boarding,' call you it? I'll be sure to keep him

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: above deck.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: So will I if he come under my hatches, I'll never

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to sea again. Let's be revenged on him: let's

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: appoint him a meeting; give him a show of comfort in

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: his suit and lead him on with a fine-baited delay,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: till he hath pawned his horses to mine host of the Garter.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, I will consent to act any villany against him,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: that may not sully the chariness of our honesty. O,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: that my husband saw this letter! it would give

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: eternal food to his jealousy.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, look where he comes; and my good man too: he's

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: as far from jealousy as I am from giving him cause;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and that I hope is an unmeasurable distance.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: You are the happier woman.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Let's consult together against this greasy knight.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come hither.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: They retire

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter FORD with PISTOL, and PAGE with NYM

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well, I hope it be not so.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Hope is a curtal dog in some affairs:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Sir John affects thy wife.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Why, sir, my wife is not young.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: He wooes both high and low, both rich and poor,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Both young and old, one with another, Ford;

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: He loves the gallimaufry: Ford, perpend.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Love my wife!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: With liver burning hot. Prevent, or go thou,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Like Sir Actaeon he, with Ringwood at thy heels:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: O, odious is the name!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: What name, sir?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: The horn, I say. Farewell.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Take heed, have open eye, for thieves do foot by night:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Take heed, ere summer comes or cuckoo-birds do sing.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Away, Sir Corporal Nym!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Believe it, Page; he speaks sense.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: [Aside]  I will be patient; I will find out this.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: [To PAGE]  And this is true; I like not the humour

speaker: NYM
text_entry: of lying. He hath wronged me in some humours: I

speaker: NYM
text_entry: should have borne the humoured letter to her; but I

speaker: NYM
text_entry: have a sword and it shall bite upon my necessity.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: He loves your wife; there's the short and the long.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: My name is Corporal Nym; I speak and I avouch; 'tis

speaker: NYM
text_entry: true: my name is Nym and Falstaff loves your wife.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Adieu. I love not the humour of bread and cheese,

speaker: NYM
text_entry: and there's the humour of it. Adieu.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'The humour of it,' quoth a'! here's a fellow

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: frights English out of his wits.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will seek out Falstaff.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I never heard such a drawling, affecting rogue.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: If I do find it: well.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I will not believe such a Cataian, though the priest

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: o' the town commended him for a true man.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: 'Twas a good sensible fellow: well.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Meg!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: MISTRESS PAGE and MISTRESS FORD come forward

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Whither go you, George? Hark you.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: How now, sweet Frank! why art thou melancholy?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I melancholy! I am not melancholy. Get you home, go.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Faith, thou hast some crotchets in thy head. Now,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: will you go, Mistress Page?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Have with you. You'll come to dinner, George.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Aside to MISTRESS FORD

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Look who comes yonder: she shall be our messenger

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to this paltry knight.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: [Aside to MISTRESS PAGE]  Trust me, I thought on her:

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: she'll fit it.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You are come to see my daughter Anne?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Ay, forsooth; and, I pray, how does good Mistress Anne?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Go in with us and see: we have an hour's talk with

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: you.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD, and MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Master Ford!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: You heard what this knave told me, did you not?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yes: and you heard what the other told me?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Do you think there is truth in them?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Hang 'em, slaves! I do not think the knight would

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: offer it: but these that accuse him in his intent

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: towards our wives are a yoke of his discarded men;

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: very rogues, now they be out of service.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Were they his men?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Marry, were they.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I like it never the better for that. Does he lie at

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the Garter?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Ay, marry, does he. If he should intend this voyage

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: towards my wife, I would turn her loose to him; and

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: what he gets more of her than sharp words, let it

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: lie on my head.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I do not misdoubt my wife; but I would be loath to

speaker: FORD
text_entry: turn them together. A man may be too confident: I

speaker: FORD
text_entry: would have nothing lie on my head: I cannot be thus satisfied.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Look where my ranting host of the Garter comes:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: there is either liquor in his pate or money in his

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: purse when he looks so merrily.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter Host

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, mine host!

speaker: Host
text_entry: How now, bully-rook! thou'rt a gentleman.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Cavaleiro-justice, I say!

speaker: Host
text_entry: Enter SHALLOW

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I follow, mine host, I follow. Good even and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: twenty, good Master Page! Master Page, will you go

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: with us? we have sport in hand.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Tell him, cavaleiro-justice; tell him, bully-rook.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Sir, there is a fray to be fought between Sir Hugh

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: the Welsh priest and Caius the French doctor.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Good mine host o' the Garter, a word with you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Drawing him aside

speaker: Host
text_entry: What sayest thou, my bully-rook?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: [To PAGE]  Will you go with us to behold it? My

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: merry host hath had the measuring of their weapons;

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: and, I think, hath appointed them contrary places;

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: for, believe me, I hear the parson is no jester.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Hark, I will tell you what our sport shall be.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hast thou no suit against my knight, my

speaker: Host
text_entry: guest-cavaleire?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: None, I protest: but I'll give you a pottle of

speaker: FORD
text_entry: burnt sack to give me recourse to him and tell him

speaker: FORD
text_entry: my name is Brook; only for a jest.

speaker: Host
text_entry: My hand, bully; thou shalt have egress and regress;

speaker: Host
text_entry: --said I well?--and thy name shall be Brook. It is

speaker: Host
text_entry: a merry knight. Will you go, An-heires?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Have with you, mine host.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I have heard the Frenchman hath good skill in

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: his rapier.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Tut, sir, I could have told you more. In these times

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: you stand on distance, your passes, stoccadoes, and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I know not what: 'tis the heart, Master Page; 'tis

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: here, 'tis here. I have seen the time, with my long

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: sword I would have made you four tall fellows skip like rats.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Here, boys, here, here! shall we wag?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Have with you. I would rather hear them scold than fight.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt Host, SHALLOW, and PAGE

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Though Page be a secure fool, an stands so firmly

speaker: FORD
text_entry: on his wife's frailty, yet I cannot put off my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: opinion so easily: she was in his company at Page's

speaker: FORD
text_entry: house; and what they made there, I know not. Well,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will look further into't: and I have a disguise

speaker: FORD
text_entry: to sound Falstaff. If I find her honest, I lose not

speaker: FORD
text_entry: my labour; if she be otherwise, 'tis labour well bestowed.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: SCENE II. A room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF and PISTOL

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I will not lend thee a penny.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Why, then the world's mine oyster.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Which I with sword will open.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Not a penny. I have been content, sir, you should

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lay my countenance to pawn; I have grated upon my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: good friends for three reprieves for you and your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: coach-fellow Nym; or else you had looked through

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the grate, like a geminy of baboons. I am damned in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hell for swearing to gentlemen my friends, you were

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: good soldiers and tall fellows; and when Mistress

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Bridget lost the handle of her fan, I took't upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: mine honour thou hadst it not.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Didst not thou share? hadst thou not fifteen pence?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Reason, you rogue, reason: thinkest thou I'll

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: endanger my soul gratis? At a word, hang no more

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: about me, I am no gibbet for you. Go. A short knife

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and a throng! To your manor of Pickt-hatch! Go.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You'll not bear a letter for me, you rogue! you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: stand upon your honour! Why, thou unconfinable

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: baseness, it is as much as I can do to keep the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: terms of my honour precise: I, I, I myself

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sometimes, leaving the fear of God on the left hand

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and hiding mine honour in my necessity, am fain to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shuffle, to hedge and to lurch; and yet you, rogue,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: will ensconce your rags, your cat-a-mountain

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: looks, your red-lattice phrases, and your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bold-beating oaths, under the shelter of your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: honour! You will not do it, you!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: I do relent: what would thou more of man?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Enter ROBIN

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: Sir, here's a woman would speak with you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Let her approach.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Give your worship good morrow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Good morrow, good wife.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Not so, an't please your worship.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Good maid, then.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: I'll be sworn,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: As my mother was, the first hour I was born.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I do believe the swearer. What with me?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Shall I vouchsafe your worship a word or two?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Two thousand, fair woman: and I'll vouchsafe thee

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the hearing.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: There is one Mistress Ford, sir:--I pray, come a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: little nearer this ways:--I myself dwell with master

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Doctor Caius,--

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, on: Mistress Ford, you say,--

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Your worship says very true: I pray your worship,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: come a little nearer this ways.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I warrant thee, nobody hears; mine own people, mine

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: own people.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Are they so? God bless them and make them his servants!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, Mistress Ford; what of her?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Why, sir, she's a good creature. Lord Lord! your

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: worship's a wanton! Well, heaven forgive you and all

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: of us, I pray!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford; come, Mistress Ford,--

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Marry, this is the short and the long of it; you

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: have brought her into such a canaries as 'tis

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: wonderful. The best courtier of them all, when the

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: court lay at Windsor, could never have brought her

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: to such a canary. Yet there has been knights, and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: lords, and gentlemen, with their coaches, I warrant

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: you, coach after coach, letter after letter, gift

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: after gift; smelling so sweetly, all musk, and so

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: rushling, I warrant you, in silk and gold; and in

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: such alligant terms; and in such wine and sugar of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: the best and the fairest, that would have won any

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: woman's heart; and, I warrant you, they could never

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: get an eye-wink of her: I had myself twenty angels

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: given me this morning; but I defy all angels, in

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: any such sort, as they say, but in the way of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: honesty: and, I warrant you, they could never get

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: her so much as sip on a cup with the proudest of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: them all: and yet there has been earls, nay, which

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: is more, pensioners; but, I warrant you, all is one with her.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: But what says she to me? be brief, my good

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: she-Mercury.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Marry, she hath received your letter, for the which

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: she thanks you a thousand times; and she gives you

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: to notify that her husband will be absence from his

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: house between ten and eleven.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ten and eleven?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Ay, forsooth; and then you may come and see the

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: picture, she says, that you wot of: Master Ford,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: her husband, will be from home. Alas! the sweet

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: woman leads an ill life with him: he's a very

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: jealousy man: she leads a very frampold life with

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: him, good heart.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ten and eleven. Woman, commend me to her; I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not fail her.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Why, you say well. But I have another messenger to

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: your worship. Mistress Page hath her hearty

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: commendations to you too: and let me tell you in

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: your ear, she's as fartuous a civil modest wife, and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: one, I tell you, that will not miss you morning nor

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: evening prayer, as any is in Windsor, whoe'er be the

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: other: and she bade me tell your worship that her

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: husband is seldom from home; but she hopes there

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: will come a time. I never knew a woman so dote upon

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: a man: surely I think you have charms, la; yes, in truth.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Not I, I assure thee: setting the attractions of my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: good parts aside I have no other charms.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Blessing on your heart for't!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: But, I pray thee, tell me this: has Ford's wife and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Page's wife acquainted each other how they love me?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: That were a jest indeed! they have not so little

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: grace, I hope: that were a trick indeed! but

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Mistress Page would desire you to send her your

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: little page, of all loves: her husband has a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: marvellous infection to the little page; and truly

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Master Page is an honest man. Never a wife in

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Windsor leads a better life than she does: do what

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: she will, say what she will, take all, pay all, go

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: to bed when she list, rise when she list, all is as

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: she will: and truly she deserves it; for if there

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: be a kind woman in Windsor, she is one. You must

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: send her your page; no remedy.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, I will.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Nay, but do so, then: and, look you, he may come and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: go between you both; and in any case have a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: nay-word, that you may know one another's mind, and

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: the boy never need to understand any thing; for

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: 'tis not good that children should know any

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: wickedness: old folks, you know, have discretion,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: as they say, and know the world.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Fare thee well: commend me to them both: there's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: my purse; I am yet thy debtor. Boy, go along with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: this woman.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exeunt MISTRESS QUICKLY and ROBIN

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: This news distracts me!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: This punk is one of Cupid's carriers:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Clap on more sails; pursue; up with your fights:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Give fire: she is my prize, or ocean whelm them all!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sayest thou so, old Jack? go thy ways; I'll make

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: more of thy old body than I have done. Will they

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: yet look after thee? Wilt thou, after the expense

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of so much money, be now a gainer? Good body, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thank thee. Let them say 'tis grossly done; so it be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fairly done, no matter.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter BARDOLPH

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Sir John, there's one Master Brook below would fain

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: speak with you, and be acquainted with you; and hath

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: sent your worship a morning's draught of sack.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Brook is his name?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Ay, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Call him in.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Such Brooks are welcome to me, that o'erflow such

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: liquor. Ah, ha! Mistress Ford and Mistress Page

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have I encompassed you? go to; via!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter BARDOLPH, with FORD disguised

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Bless you, sir!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And you, sir! Would you speak with me?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I make bold to press with so little preparation upon

speaker: FORD
text_entry: you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You're welcome. What's your will? Give us leave, drawer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit BARDOLPH

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Sir, I am a gentleman that have spent much; my name is Brook.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Good Master Brook, I desire more acquaintance of you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Good Sir John, I sue for yours: not to charge you;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: for I must let you understand I think myself in

speaker: FORD
text_entry: better plight for a lender than you are: the which

speaker: FORD
text_entry: hath something embolden'd me to this unseasoned

speaker: FORD
text_entry: intrusion; for they say, if money go before, all

speaker: FORD
text_entry: ways do lie open.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Money is a good soldier, sir, and will on.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Troth, and I have a bag of money here troubles me:

speaker: FORD
text_entry: if you will help to bear it, Sir John, take all, or

speaker: FORD
text_entry: half, for easing me of the carriage.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sir, I know not how I may deserve to be your porter.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will tell you, sir, if you will give me the hearing.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Speak, good Master Brook: I shall be glad to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: your servant.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Sir, I hear you are a scholar,--I will be brief

speaker: FORD
text_entry: with you,--and you have been a man long known to me,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: though I had never so good means, as desire, to make

speaker: FORD
text_entry: myself acquainted with you. I shall discover a

speaker: FORD
text_entry: thing to you, wherein I must very much lay open mine

speaker: FORD
text_entry: own imperfection: but, good Sir John, as you have

speaker: FORD
text_entry: one eye upon my follies, as you hear them unfolded,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: turn another into the register of your own; that I

speaker: FORD
text_entry: may pass with a reproof the easier, sith you

speaker: FORD
text_entry: yourself know how easy it is to be such an offender.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Very well, sir; proceed.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: There is a gentlewoman in this town; her husband's

speaker: FORD
text_entry: name is Ford.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, sir.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I have long loved her, and, I protest to you,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: bestowed much on her; followed her with a doting

speaker: FORD
text_entry: observance; engrossed opportunities to meet her;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: fee'd every slight occasion that could but niggardly

speaker: FORD
text_entry: give me sight of her; not only bought many presents

speaker: FORD
text_entry: to give her, but have given largely to many to know

speaker: FORD
text_entry: what she would have given; briefly, I have pursued

speaker: FORD
text_entry: her as love hath pursued me; which hath been on the

speaker: FORD
text_entry: wing of all occasions. But whatsoever I have

speaker: FORD
text_entry: merited, either in my mind or, in my means, meed,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I am sure, I have received none; unless experience

speaker: FORD
text_entry: be a jewel that I have purchased at an infinite

speaker: FORD
text_entry: rate, and that hath taught me to say this:

speaker: FORD
text_entry: 'Love like a shadow flies when substance love pursues;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pursuing that that flies, and flying what pursues.'

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have you received no promise of satisfaction at her hands?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Never.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have you importuned her to such a purpose?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Never.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Of what quality was your love, then?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Like a fair house built on another man's ground; so

speaker: FORD
text_entry: that I have lost my edifice by mistaking the place

speaker: FORD
text_entry: where I erected it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: To what purpose have you unfolded this to me?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: When I have told you that, I have told you all.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Some say, that though she appear honest to me, yet in

speaker: FORD
text_entry: other places she enlargeth her mirth so far that

speaker: FORD
text_entry: there is shrewd construction made of her. Now, Sir

speaker: FORD
text_entry: John, here is the heart of my purpose: you are a

speaker: FORD
text_entry: gentleman of excellent breeding, admirable

speaker: FORD
text_entry: discourse, of great admittance, authentic in your

speaker: FORD
text_entry: place and person, generally allowed for your many

speaker: FORD
text_entry: war-like, court-like, and learned preparations.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O, sir!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Believe it, for you know it. There is money; spend

speaker: FORD
text_entry: it, spend it; spend more; spend all I have; only

speaker: FORD
text_entry: give me so much of your time in exchange of it, as

speaker: FORD
text_entry: to lay an amiable siege to the honesty of this

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ford's wife: use your art of wooing; win her to

speaker: FORD
text_entry: consent to you: if any man may, you may as soon as

speaker: FORD
text_entry: any.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Would it apply well to the vehemency of your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: affection, that I should win what you would enjoy?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Methinks you prescribe to yourself very preposterously.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: O, understand my drift. She dwells so securely on

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the excellency of her honour, that the folly of my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: soul dares not present itself: she is too bright to

speaker: FORD
text_entry: be looked against. Now, could I could come to her

speaker: FORD
text_entry: with any detection in my hand, my desires had

speaker: FORD
text_entry: instance and argument to commend themselves: I

speaker: FORD
text_entry: could drive her then from the ward of her purity,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: her reputation, her marriage-vow, and a thousand

speaker: FORD
text_entry: other her defences, which now are too too strongly

speaker: FORD
text_entry: embattled against me. What say you to't, Sir John?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Master Brook, I will first make bold with your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: money; next, give me your hand; and last, as I am a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: gentleman, you shall, if you will, enjoy Ford's wife.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: O good sir!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I say you shall.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Want no money, Sir John; you shall want none.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Want no Mistress Ford, Master Brook; you shall want

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: none. I shall be with her, I may tell you, by her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: own appointment; even as you came in to me, her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: assistant or go-between parted from me: I say I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shall be with her between ten and eleven; for at

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that time the jealous rascally knave her husband

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: will be forth. Come you to me at night; you shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: know how I speed.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I am blest in your acquaintance. Do you know Ford,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hang him, poor cuckoldly knave! I know him not:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: yet I wrong him to call him poor; they say the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: jealous wittolly knave hath masses of money; for the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: which his wife seems to me well-favored. I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: use her as the key of the cuckoldly rogue's coffer;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and there's my harvest-home.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I would you knew Ford, sir, that you might avoid him

speaker: FORD
text_entry: if you saw him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hang him, mechanical salt-butter rogue! I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: stare him out of his wits; I will awe him with my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cudgel: it shall hang like a meteor o'er the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cuckold's horns. Master Brook, thou shalt know I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: will predominate over the peasant, and thou shalt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lie with his wife. Come to me soon at night.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ford's a knave, and I will aggravate his style;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou, Master Brook, shalt know him for knave and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cuckold. Come to me soon at night.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: What a damned Epicurean rascal is this! My heart is

speaker: FORD
text_entry: ready to crack with impatience. Who says this is

speaker: FORD
text_entry: improvident jealousy? my wife hath sent to him; the

speaker: FORD
text_entry: hour is fixed; the match is made. Would any man

speaker: FORD
text_entry: have thought this? See the hell of having a false

speaker: FORD
text_entry: woman! My bed shall be abused, my coffers

speaker: FORD
