text_entry: ransacked, my reputation gnawn at; and I shall not

speaker: FORD
text_entry: only receive this villanous wrong, but stand under

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the adoption of abominable terms, and by him that

speaker: FORD
text_entry: does me this wrong. Terms! names! Amaimon sounds

speaker: FORD
text_entry: well; Lucifer, well; Barbason, well; yet they are

speaker: FORD
text_entry: devils' additions, the names of fiends: but

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Cuckold! Wittol!--Cuckold! the devil himself hath

speaker: FORD
text_entry: not such a name. Page is an ass, a secure ass: he

speaker: FORD
text_entry: will trust his wife; he will not be jealous. I will

speaker: FORD
text_entry: rather trust a Fleming with my butter, Parson Hugh

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the Welshman with my cheese, an Irishman with my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: aqua-vitae bottle, or a thief to walk my ambling

speaker: FORD
text_entry: gelding, than my wife with herself; then she plots,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: then she ruminates, then she devises; and what they

speaker: FORD
text_entry: think in their hearts they may effect, they will

speaker: FORD
text_entry: break their hearts but they will effect. God be

speaker: FORD
text_entry: praised for my jealousy! Eleven o'clock the hour.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will prevent this, detect my wife, be revenged on

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Falstaff, and laugh at Page. I will about it;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: better three hours too soon than a minute too late.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Fie, fie, fie! cuckold! cuckold! cuckold!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: SCENE III. A field near Windsor.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Enter DOCTOR CAIUS and RUGBY

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Jack Rugby!

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: Sir?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vat is de clock, Jack?

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: 'Tis past the hour, sir, that Sir Hugh promised to meet.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, he has save his soul, dat he is no come; he

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: has pray his Pible well, dat he is no come: by gar,

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Jack Rugby, he is dead already, if he be come.

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: He is wise, sir; he knew your worship would kill

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: him, if he came.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, de herring is no dead so as I vill kill him.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Take your rapier, Jack; I vill tell you how I vill kill him.

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: Alas, sir, I cannot fence.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Villany, take your rapier.

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: Forbear; here's company.

speaker: RUGBY
text_entry: Enter Host, SHALLOW, SLENDER, and PAGE

speaker: Host
text_entry: Bless thee, bully doctor!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Save you, Master Doctor Caius!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Now, good master doctor!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Give you good morrow, sir.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vat be all you, one, two, tree, four, come for?

speaker: Host
text_entry: To see thee fight, to see thee foin, to see thee

speaker: Host
text_entry: traverse; to see thee here, to see thee there; to

speaker: Host
text_entry: see thee pass thy punto, thy stock, thy reverse, thy

speaker: Host
text_entry: distance, thy montant. Is he dead, my Ethiopian? is

speaker: Host
text_entry: he dead, my Francisco? ha, bully! What says my

speaker: Host
text_entry: AEsculapius? my Galen? my heart of elder? ha! is

speaker: Host
text_entry: he dead, bully stale? is he dead?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, he is de coward Jack priest of de vorld; he

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: is not show his face.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Thou art a Castalion-King-Urinal. Hector of Greece, my boy!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I pray you, bear vitness that me have stay six or

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: seven, two, tree hours for him, and he is no come.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: He is the wiser man, master doctor: he is a curer of

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: souls, and you a curer of bodies; if you should

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: fight, you go against the hair of your professions.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Is it not true, Master Page?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Master Shallow, you have yourself been a great

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: fighter, though now a man of peace.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Bodykins, Master Page, though I now be old and of

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: the peace, if I see a sword out, my finger itches to

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: make one. Though we are justices and doctors and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: churchmen, Master Page, we have some salt of our

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: youth in us; we are the sons of women, Master Page.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'Tis true, Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: It will be found so, Master Page. Master Doctor

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Caius, I am come to fetch you home. I am sworn of

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: the peace: you have showed yourself a wise

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: physician, and Sir Hugh hath shown himself a wise

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: and patient churchman. You must go with me, master doctor.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Pardon, guest-justice. A word, Mounseur Mockwater.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Mock-vater! vat is dat?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Mock-water, in our English tongue, is valour, bully.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, den, I have as mush mock-vater as de

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Englishman. Scurvy jack-dog priest! by gar, me

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: vill cut his ears.

speaker: Host
text_entry: He will clapper-claw thee tightly, bully.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Clapper-de-claw! vat is dat?

speaker: Host
text_entry: That is, he will make thee amends.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, me do look he shall clapper-de-claw me;

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: for, by gar, me vill have it.

speaker: Host
text_entry: And I will provoke him to't, or let him wag.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Me tank you for dat.

speaker: Host
text_entry: And, moreover, bully,--but first, master guest, and

speaker: Host
text_entry: Master Page, and eke Cavaleiro Slender, go you

speaker: Host
text_entry: through the town to Frogmore.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Aside to them

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Sir Hugh is there, is he?

speaker: Host
text_entry: He is there: see what humour he is in; and I will

speaker: Host
text_entry: bring the doctor about by the fields. Will it do well?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: We will do it.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Adieu, good master doctor.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Exeunt PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, me vill kill de priest; for he speak for a

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: jack-an-ape to Anne Page.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Let him die: sheathe thy impatience, throw cold

speaker: Host
text_entry: water on thy choler: go about the fields with me

speaker: Host
text_entry: through Frogmore: I will bring thee where Mistress

speaker: Host
text_entry: Anne Page is, at a farm-house a-feasting; and thou

speaker: Host
text_entry: shalt woo her. Cried I aim? said I well?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, me dank you for dat: by gar, I love you;

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: and I shall procure-a you de good guest, de earl,

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: de knight, de lords, de gentlemen, my patients.

speaker: Host
text_entry: For the which I will be thy adversary toward Anne

speaker: Host
text_entry: Page. Said I well?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, 'tis good; vell said.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Let us wag, then.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Come at my heels, Jack Rugby.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. A field near Frogmore.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS and SIMPLE

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I pray you now, good master Slender's serving-man,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and friend Simple by your name, which way have you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: looked for Master Caius, that calls himself doctor of physic?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Marry, sir, the pittie-ward, the park-ward, every

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: way; old Windsor way, and every way but the town

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: way.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I most fehemently desire you you will also look that

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: way.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: I will, sir.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Pless my soul, how full of chollors I am, and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: trempling of mind! I shall be glad if he have

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: deceived me. How melancholies I am! I will knog

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: his urinals about his knave's costard when I have

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: good opportunities for the ork. 'Pless my soul!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sings

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow rivers, to whose falls

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Melodious birds sings madrigals;

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: There will we make our peds of roses,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And a thousand fragrant posies.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow--

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Mercy on me! I have a great dispositions to cry.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sings

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Melodious birds sing madrigals--

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: When as I sat in Pabylon--

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And a thousand vagram posies.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow  and c.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Re-enter SIMPLE

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Yonder he is coming, this way, Sir Hugh.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: He's welcome.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sings

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow rivers, to whose falls-

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Heaven prosper the right! What weapons is he?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: No weapons, sir. There comes my master, Master

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Shallow, and another gentleman, from Frogmore, over

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: the stile, this way.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pray you, give me my gown; or else keep it in your arms.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: How now, master Parson! Good morrow, good Sir Hugh.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Keep a gamester from the dice, and a good student

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: from his book, and it is wonderful.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: [Aside]  Ah, sweet Anne Page!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'Save you, good Sir Hugh!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Pless you from his mercy sake, all of you!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: What, the sword and the word! do you study them

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: both, master parson?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And youthful still! in your doublet and hose this

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: raw rheumatic day!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: There is reasons and causes for it.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: We are come to you to do a good office, master parson.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Fery well: what is it?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yonder is a most reverend gentleman, who, belike

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: having received wrong by some person, is at most

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: odds with his own gravity and patience that ever you

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: saw.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I have lived fourscore years and upward; I never

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: heard a man of his place, gravity and learning, so

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: wide of his own respect.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: What is he?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I think you know him; Master Doctor Caius, the

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: renowned French physician.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Got's will, and his passion of my heart! I had as

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: lief you would tell me of a mess of porridge.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: He has no more knowledge in Hibocrates and Galen,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: --and he is a knave besides; a cowardly knave as you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: would desires to be acquainted withal.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I warrant you, he's the man should fight with him.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: [Aside]  O sweet Anne Page!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: It appears so by his weapons. Keep them asunder:

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: here comes Doctor Caius.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Enter Host, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Nay, good master parson, keep in your weapon.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: So do you, good master doctor.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Disarm them, and let them question: let them keep

speaker: Host
text_entry: their limbs whole and hack our English.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I pray you, let-a me speak a word with your ear.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vherefore vill you not meet-a me?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: [Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS]  Pray you, use your patience:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: in good time.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, you are de coward, de Jack dog, John ape.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: [Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS]  Pray you let us not be

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: laughing-stocks to other men's humours; I desire you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: in friendship, and I will one way or other make you amends.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Aloud

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I will knog your urinals about your knave's cockscomb

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: for missing your meetings and appointments.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Diable! Jack Rugby,--mine host de Jarteer,--have I

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: not stay for him to kill him? have I not, at de place

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I did appoint?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: As I am a Christians soul now, look you, this is the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: place appointed: I'll be judgement by mine host of

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: the Garter.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Peace, I say, Gallia and Gaul, French and Welsh,

speaker: Host
text_entry: soul-curer and body-curer!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ay, dat is very good; excellent.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Peace, I say! hear mine host of the Garter. Am I

speaker: Host
text_entry: politic? am I subtle? am I a Machiavel? Shall I

speaker: Host
text_entry: lose my doctor? no; he gives me the potions and the

speaker: Host
text_entry: motions. Shall I lose my parson, my priest, my Sir

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hugh? no; he gives me the proverbs and the

speaker: Host
text_entry: no-verbs. Give me thy hand, terrestrial; so. Give me

speaker: Host
text_entry: thy hand, celestial; so. Boys of art, I have

speaker: Host
text_entry: deceived you both; I have directed you to wrong

speaker: Host
text_entry: places: your hearts are mighty, your skins are

speaker: Host
text_entry: whole, and let burnt sack be the issue. Come, lay

speaker: Host
text_entry: their swords to pawn. Follow me, lads of peace;

speaker: Host
text_entry: follow, follow, follow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Trust me, a mad host. Follow, gentlemen, follow.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: [Aside]  O sweet Anne Page!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Exeunt SHALLOW, SLENDER, PAGE, and Host

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ha, do I perceive dat? have you make-a de sot of

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: us, ha, ha?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: This is well; he has made us his vlouting-stog. I

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: desire you that we may be friends; and let us knog

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: our prains together to be revenge on this same

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: scall, scurvy cogging companion, the host of the Garter.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, with all my heart. He promise to bring me

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: where is Anne Page; by gar, he deceive me too.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Well, I will smite his noddles. Pray you, follow.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: SCENE II. A street.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS PAGE and ROBIN

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Nay, keep your way, little gallant; you were wont to

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: be a follower, but now you are a leader. Whether

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: had you rather lead mine eyes, or eye your master's heels?

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: I had rather, forsooth, go before you like a man

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: than follow him like a dwarf.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: O, you are a flattering boy: now I see you'll be a courtier.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter FORD

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well met, Mistress Page. Whither go you?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Truly, sir, to see your wife. Is she at home?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ay; and as idle as she may hang together, for want

speaker: FORD
text_entry: of company. I think, if your husbands were dead,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: you two would marry.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Be sure of that,--two other husbands.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Where had you this pretty weather-cock?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I cannot tell what the dickens his name is my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: husband had him of. What do you call your knight's

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: name, sirrah?

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: Sir John Falstaff.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Sir John Falstaff!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: He, he; I can never hit on's name. There is such a

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: league between my good man and he! Is your wife at

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: home indeed?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Indeed she is.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: By your leave, sir: I am sick till I see her.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE and ROBIN

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Has Page any brains? hath he any eyes? hath he any

speaker: FORD
text_entry: thinking? Sure, they sleep; he hath no use of them.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Why, this boy will carry a letter twenty mile, as

speaker: FORD
text_entry: easy as a cannon will shoot point-blank twelve

speaker: FORD
text_entry: score. He pieces out his wife's inclination; he

speaker: FORD
text_entry: gives her folly motion and advantage: and now she's

speaker: FORD
text_entry: going to my wife, and Falstaff's boy with her. A

speaker: FORD
text_entry: man may hear this shower sing in the wind. And

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Falstaff's boy with her! Good plots, they are laid;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: and our revolted wives share damnation together.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well; I will take him, then torture my wife, pluck

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the borrowed veil of modesty from the so seeming

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Mistress Page, divulge Page himself for a secure and

speaker: FORD
text_entry: wilful Actaeon; and to these violent proceedings all

speaker: FORD
text_entry: my neighbours shall cry aim.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Clock heard

speaker: FORD
text_entry: The clock gives me my cue, and my assurance bids me

speaker: FORD
text_entry: search: there I shall find Falstaff: I shall be

speaker: FORD
text_entry: rather praised for this than mocked; for it is as

speaker: FORD
text_entry: positive as the earth is firm that Falstaff is

speaker: FORD
text_entry: there: I will go.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, SLENDER, Host, SIR HUGH EVANS, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Well met, Master Ford.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Trust me, a good knot: I have good cheer at home;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: and I pray you all go with me.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I must excuse myself, Master Ford.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: And so must I, sir: we have appointed to dine with

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Mistress Anne, and I would not break with her for

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: more money than I'll speak of.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: We have lingered about a match between Anne Page and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: my cousin Slender, and this day we shall have our answer.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I hope I have your good will, father Page.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: You have, Master Slender; I stand wholly for you:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: but my wife, master doctor, is for you altogether.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ay, be-gar; and de maid is love-a me: my nursh-a

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Quickly tell me so mush.

speaker: Host
text_entry: What say you to young Master Fenton? he capers, he

speaker: Host
text_entry: dances, he has eyes of youth, he writes verses, he

speaker: Host
text_entry: speaks holiday, he smells April and May: he will

speaker: Host
text_entry: carry't, he will carry't; 'tis in his buttons; he

speaker: Host
text_entry: will carry't.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Not by my consent, I promise you. The gentleman is

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: of no having: he kept company with the wild prince

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: and Poins; he is of too high a region; he knows too

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: much. No, he shall not knit a knot in his fortunes

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: with the finger of my substance: if he take her,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: let him take her simply; the wealth I have waits on

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: my consent, and my consent goes not that way.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I beseech you heartily, some of you go home with me

speaker: FORD
text_entry: to dinner: besides your cheer, you shall have

speaker: FORD
text_entry: sport; I will show you a monster. Master doctor,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: you shall go; so shall you, Master Page; and you, Sir Hugh.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Well, fare you well: we shall have the freer wooing

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: at Master Page's.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Exeunt SHALLOW, and SLENDER

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Go home, John Rugby; I come anon.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exit RUGBY

speaker: Host
text_entry: Farewell, my hearts: I will to my honest knight

speaker: Host
text_entry: Falstaff, and drink canary with him.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: [Aside]  I think I shall drink in pipe wine first

speaker: FORD
text_entry: with him; I'll make him dance. Will you go, gentles?

speaker: All
text_entry: Have with you to see this monster.

speaker: All
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: All
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in FORD'S house.

speaker: All
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What, John! What, Robert!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Quickly, quickly! is the buck-basket--

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I warrant. What, Robin, I say!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter Servants with a basket

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come, come, come.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Here, set it down.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Give your men the charge; we must be brief.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Marry, as I told you before, John and Robert, be

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: ready here hard by in the brew-house: and when I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: suddenly call you, come forth, and without any pause

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: or staggering take this basket on your shoulders:

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: that done, trudge with it in all haste, and carry

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: it among the whitsters in Datchet-mead, and there

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: empty it in the muddy ditch close by the Thames side.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You will do it?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I ha' told them over and over; they lack no

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: direction. Be gone, and come when you are called.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exeunt Servants

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Here comes little Robin.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter ROBIN

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: How now, my eyas-musket! what news with you?

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: My master, Sir John, is come in at your back-door,

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: Mistress Ford, and requests your company.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You little Jack-a-Lent, have you been true to us?

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: Ay, I'll be sworn. My master knows not of your

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: being here and hath threatened to put me into

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: everlasting liberty if I tell you of it; for he

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: swears he'll turn me away.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Thou'rt a good boy: this secrecy of thine shall be

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: a tailor to thee and shall make thee a new doublet

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and hose. I'll go hide me.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Do so. Go tell thy master I am alone.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exit ROBIN

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Mistress Page, remember you your cue.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I warrant thee; if I do not act it, hiss me.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Go to, then: we'll use this unwholesome humidity,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: this gross watery pumpion; we'll teach him to know

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: turtles from jays.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have I caught thee, my heavenly jewel? Why, now let

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me die, for I have lived long enough: this is the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: period of my ambition: O this blessed hour!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: O sweet Sir John!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford, I cannot cog, I cannot prate,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford. Now shall I sin in my wish: I would

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thy husband were dead: I'll speak it before the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: best lord; I would make thee my lady.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I your lady, Sir John! alas, I should be a pitiful lady!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Let the court of France show me such another. I see

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: how thine eye would emulate the diamond: thou hast

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the right arched beauty of the brow that becomes the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ship-tire, the tire-valiant, or any tire of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Venetian admittance.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: A plain kerchief, Sir John: my brows become nothing

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: else; nor that well neither.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the Lord, thou art a traitor to say so: thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: wouldst make an absolute courtier; and the firm

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fixture of thy foot would give an excellent motion

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to thy gait in a semi-circled farthingale. I see

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: what thou wert, if Fortune thy foe were not, Nature

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thy friend. Come, thou canst not hide it.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Believe me, there is no such thing in me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What made me love thee? let that persuade thee

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: there's something extraordinary in thee. Come, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cannot cog and say thou art this and that, like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: many of these lisping hawthorn-buds, that come like

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: women in men's apparel, and smell like Bucklersbury

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in simple time; I cannot: but I love thee; none

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: but thee; and thou deservest it.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Do not betray me, sir. I fear you love Mistress Page.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Thou mightst as well say I love to walk by the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Counter-gate, which is as hateful to me as the reek

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of a lime-kiln.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Well, heaven knows how I love you; and you shall one

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: day find it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Keep in that mind; I'll deserve it.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, I must tell you, so you do; or else I could not

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: be in that mind.

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: [Within]  Mistress Ford, Mistress Ford! here's

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: Mistress Page at the door, sweating and blowing and

speaker: ROBIN
text_entry: looking wildly, and would needs speak with you presently.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: She shall not see me: I will ensconce me behind the arras.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Pray you, do so: she's a very tattling woman.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: FALSTAFF hides himself

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Re-enter MISTRESS PAGE and ROBIN

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What's the matter? how now!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: O Mistress Ford, what have you done? You're shamed,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: you're overthrown, you're undone for ever!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What's the matter, good Mistress Page?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: O well-a-day, Mistress Ford! having an honest man

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to your husband, to give him such cause of suspicion!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What cause of suspicion?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What cause of suspicion! Out pon you! how am I

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: mistook in you!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, alas, what's the matter?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Your husband's coming hither, woman, with all the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: officers in Windsor, to search for a gentleman that

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: he says is here now in the house by your consent, to

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: take an ill advantage of his assence: you are undone.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: 'Tis not so, I hope.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Pray heaven it be not so, that you have such a man

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: here! but 'tis most certain your husband's coming,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: with half Windsor at his heels, to search for such a

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: one. I come before to tell you. If you know

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: yourself clear, why, I am glad of it; but if you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: have a friend here convey, convey him out. Be not

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: amazed; call all your senses to you; defend your

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: reputation, or bid farewell to your good life for ever.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What shall I do? There is a gentleman my dear

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: friend; and I fear not mine own shame so much as his

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: peril: I had rather than a thousand pound he were

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: out of the house.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: For shame! never stand 'you had rather' and 'you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: had rather:' your husband's here at hand, bethink

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: you of some conveyance: in the house you cannot

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: hide him. O, how have you deceived me! Look, here

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: is a basket: if he be of any reasonable stature, he

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: may creep in here; and throw foul linen upon him, as

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: if it were going to bucking: or--it is whiting-time

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: --send him by your two men to Datchet-mead.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: He's too big to go in there. What shall I do?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: [Coming forward]  Let me see't, let me see't, O, let

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me see't! I'll in, I'll in. Follow your friend's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: counsel. I'll in.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What, Sir John Falstaff! Are these your letters, knight?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I love thee. Help me away. Let me creep in here.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll never--

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Gets into the basket; they cover him with foul linen

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Help to cover your master, boy. Call your men,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Mistress Ford. You dissembling knight!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What, John! Robert! John!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exit ROBIN

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Re-enter Servants

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Go take up these clothes here quickly. Where's the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: cowl-staff? look, how you drumble! Carry them to

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: the laundress in Datchet-meat; quickly, come.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter FORD, PAGE, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pray you, come near: if I suspect without cause,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: why then make sport at me; then let me be your jest;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I deserve it. How now! whither bear you this?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: To the laundress, forsooth.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, what have you to do whither they bear it? You

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: were best meddle with buck-washing.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Buck! I would I could wash myself of the buck!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Buck, buck, buck! Ay, buck; I warrant you, buck;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: and of the season too, it shall appear.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exeunt Servants with the basket

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Gentlemen, I have dreamed to-night; I'll tell you my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: dream. Here, here, here be my keys: ascend my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: chambers; search, seek, find out: I'll warrant

speaker: FORD
text_entry: we'll unkennel the fox. Let me stop this way first.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Locking the door

speaker: FORD
text_entry: So, now uncape.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Good Master Ford, be contented: you wrong yourself too much.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: True, Master Page. Up, gentlemen: you shall see

speaker: FORD
text_entry: sport anon: follow me, gentlemen.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: This is fery fantastical humours and jealousies.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, 'tis no the fashion of France; it is not

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: jealous in France.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Nay, follow him, gentlemen; see the issue of his search.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt PAGE, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Is there not a double excellency in this?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I know not which pleases me better, that my husband

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: is deceived, or Sir John.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What a taking was he in when your husband asked who

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: was in the basket!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I am half afraid he will have need of washing; so

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: throwing him into the water will do him a benefit.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Hang him, dishonest rascal! I would all of the same

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: strain were in the same distress.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I think my husband hath some special suspicion of

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Falstaff's being here; for I never saw him so gross

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: in his jealousy till now.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I will lay a plot to try that; and we will yet have

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: more tricks with Falstaff: his dissolute disease will

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: scarce obey this medicine.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Shall we send that foolish carrion, Mistress

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Quickly, to him, and excuse his throwing into the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: water; and give him another hope, to betray him to

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: another punishment?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We will do it: let him be sent for to-morrow,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: eight o'clock, to have amends.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Re-enter FORD, PAGE, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I cannot find him: may be the knave bragged of that

speaker: FORD
text_entry: he could not compass.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: [Aside to MISTRESS FORD]  Heard you that?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: You use me well, Master Ford, do you?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ay, I do so.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Heaven make you better than your thoughts!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Amen!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You do yourself mighty wrong, Master Ford.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ay, ay; I must bear it.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: If there be any pody in the house, and in the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: chambers, and in the coffers, and in the presses,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: heaven forgive my sins at the day of judgment!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, nor I too: there is no bodies.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Fie, fie, Master Ford! are you not ashamed? What

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: spirit, what devil suggests this imagination? I

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: would not ha' your distemper in this kind for the

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: wealth of Windsor Castle.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: 'Tis my fault, Master Page: I suffer for it.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: You suffer for a pad conscience: your wife is as

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: honest a 'omans as I will desires among five

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: thousand, and five hundred too.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, I see 'tis an honest woman.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well, I promised you a dinner. Come, come, walk in

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the Park: I pray you, pardon me; I will hereafter

speaker: FORD
text_entry: make known to you why I have done this. Come,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: wife; come, Mistress Page. I pray you, pardon me;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: pray heartily, pardon me.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Let's go in, gentlemen; but, trust me, we'll mock

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: him. I do invite you to-morrow morning to my house

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: to breakfast: after, we'll a-birding together; I

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: have a fine hawk for the bush. Shall it be so?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Any thing.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: If there is one, I shall make two in the company.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: If dere be one or two, I shall make-a the turd.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pray you, go, Master Page.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I pray you now, remembrance tomorrow on the lousy

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: knave, mine host.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Dat is good; by gar, with all my heart!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: A lousy knave, to have his gibes and his mockeries!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: SCENE IV. A room in PAGE'S house.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter FENTON and ANNE PAGE

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: I see I cannot get thy father's love;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Therefore no more turn me to him, sweet Nan.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Alas, how then?

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Why, thou must be thyself.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: He doth object I am too great of birth--,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And that, my state being gall'd with my expense,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: I seek to heal it only by his wealth:

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Besides these, other bars he lays before me,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: My riots past, my wild societies;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And tells me 'tis a thing impossible

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: I should love thee but as a property.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: May be he tells you true.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: No, heaven so speed me in my time to come!

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Albeit I will confess thy father's wealth

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Was the first motive that I woo'd thee, Anne:

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Yet, wooing thee, I found thee of more value

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Than stamps in gold or sums in sealed bags;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And 'tis the very riches of thyself

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: That now I aim at.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Gentle Master Fenton,

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Yet seek my father's love; still seek it, sir:

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: If opportunity and humblest suit

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Cannot attain it, why, then,--hark you hither!

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Enter SHALLOW, SLENDER, and MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Break their talk, Mistress Quickly: my kinsman shall

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: speak for himself.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I'll make a shaft or a bolt on't: 'slid, 'tis but

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: venturing.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Be not dismayed.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: No, she shall not dismay me: I care not for that,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: but that I am afeard.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Hark ye; Master Slender would speak a word with you.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: I come to him.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Aside

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: This is my father's choice.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: O, what a world of vile ill-favor'd faults

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Looks handsome in three hundred pounds a-year!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And how does good Master Fenton? Pray you, a word with you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: She's coming; to her, coz. O boy, thou hadst a father!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I had a father, Mistress Anne; my uncle can tell you

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: good jests of him. Pray you, uncle, tell Mistress

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Anne the jest, how my father stole two geese out of

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: a pen, good uncle.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Mistress Anne, my cousin loves you.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, that I do; as well as I love any woman in

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Gloucestershire.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: He will maintain you like a gentlewoman.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, that I will, come cut and long-tail, under the

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: degree of a squire.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: He will make you a hundred and fifty pounds jointure.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Good Master Shallow, let him woo for himself.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Marry, I thank you for it; I thank you for that good

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: comfort. She calls you, coz: I'll leave you.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Now, Master Slender,--

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Now, good Mistress Anne,--

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: What is your will?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: My will! 'od's heartlings, that's a pretty jest

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: indeed! I ne'er made my will yet, I thank heaven; I

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: am not such a sickly creature, I give heaven praise.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: I mean, Master Slender, what would you with me?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Truly, for mine own part, I would little or nothing

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: with you. Your father and my uncle hath made

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: motions: if it be my luck, so; if not, happy man be

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: his dole! They can tell you how things go better

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: than I can: you may ask your father; here he comes.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Enter PAGE and MISTRESS PAGE

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Now, Master Slender: love him, daughter Anne.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why, how now! what does Master Fenton here?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: You wrong me, sir, thus still to haunt my house:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I told you, sir, my daughter is disposed of.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Nay, Master Page, be not impatient.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Good Master Fenton, come not to my child.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: She is no match for you.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Sir, will you hear me?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: No, good Master Fenton.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Come, Master Shallow; come, son Slender, in.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Knowing my mind, you wrong me, Master Fenton.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Speak to Mistress Page.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Good Mistress Page, for that I love your daughter

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: In such a righteous fashion as I do,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Perforce, against all cheques, rebukes and manners,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: I must advance the colours of my love

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And not retire: let me have your good will.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Good mother, do not marry me to yond fool.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I mean it not; I seek you a better husband.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: That's my master, master doctor.

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Alas, I had rather be set quick i' the earth

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: And bowl'd to death with turnips!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come, trouble not yourself. Good Master Fenton,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I will not be your friend nor enemy:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: My daughter will I question how she loves you,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And as I find her, so am I affected.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Till then farewell, sir: she must needs go in;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Her father will be angry.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Farewell, gentle mistress: farewell, Nan.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE and ANNE PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: This is my doing, now: 'Nay,' said I, 'will you cast

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: away your child on a fool, and a physician? Look on

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Master Fenton:' this is my doing.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: I thank thee; and I pray thee, once to-night

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Give my sweet Nan this ring: there's for thy pains.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Now heaven send thee good fortune!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Exit FENTON

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: A kind heart he hath: a woman would run through

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: fire and water for such a kind heart. But yet I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: would my master had Mistress Anne; or I would

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Master Slender had her; or, in sooth, I would Master

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fenton had her; I will do what I can for them all

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: three; for so I have promised, and I'll be as good

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: as my word; but speciously for Master Fenton. Well,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: I must of another errand to Sir John Falstaff from

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: my two mistresses: what a beast am I to slack it!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: SCENE V. A room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF and BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Bardolph, I say,--

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Here, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Go fetch me a quart of sack; put a toast in't.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have I lived to be carried in a basket, like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: barrow of butcher's offal, and to be thrown in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Thames? Well, if I be served such another trick,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll have my brains ta'en out and buttered, and give

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: them to a dog for a new-year's gift. The rogues

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: slighted me into the river with as little remorse as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: they would have drowned a blind bitch's puppies,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fifteen i' the litter: and you may know by my size

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that I have a kind of alacrity in sinking; if the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bottom were as deep as hell, I should down. I had

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: been drowned, but that the shore was shelvy and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shallow,--a death that I abhor; for the water swells

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a man; and what a thing should I have been when I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: had been swelled! I should have been a mountain of mummy.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter BARDOLPH with sack

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Here's Mistress Quickly, sir, to speak with you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Let me pour in some sack to the Thames water; for my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: belly's as cold as if I had swallowed snowballs for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: pills to cool the reins. Call her in.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Come in, woman!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: By your leave; I cry you mercy: give your worship

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: good morrow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Take away these chalices. Go brew me a pottle of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sack finely.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: With eggs, sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Simple of itself; I'll no pullet-sperm in my brewage.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How now!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Marry, sir, I come to your worship from Mistress Ford.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford! I have had ford enough; I was thrown

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: into the ford; I have my belly full of ford.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Alas the day! good heart, that was not her fault:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: she does so take on with her men; they mistook their erection.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: So did I mine, to build upon a foolish woman's promise.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Well, she laments, sir, for it, that it would yearn

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: your heart to see it. Her husband goes this morning

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: a-birding; she desires you once more to come to her

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: between eight and nine: I must carry her word

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: quickly: she'll make you amends, I warrant you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, I will visit her: tell her so; and bid her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: think what a man is: let her consider his frailty,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and then judge of my merit.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: I will tell her.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Do so. Between nine and ten, sayest thou?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Eight and nine, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, be gone: I will not miss her.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Peace be with you, sir.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I marvel I hear not of Master Brook; he sent me word

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to stay within: I like his money well. O, here he comes.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter FORD

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Bless you, sir!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, master Brook, you come to know what hath passed

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: between me and Ford's wife?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: That, indeed, Sir John, is my business.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Master Brook, I will not lie to you: I was at her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: house the hour she appointed me.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And sped you, sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Very ill-favoredly, Master Brook.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: How so, sir? Did she change her determination?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No, Master Brook; but the peaking Cornuto her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: husband, Master Brook, dwelling in a continual

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: 'larum of jealousy, comes me in the instant of our

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: encounter, after we had embraced, kissed, protested,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and, as it were, spoke the prologue of our comedy;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and at his heels a rabble of his companions, thither

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: provoked and instigated by his distemper, and,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forsooth, to search his house for his wife's love.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: What, while you were there?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: While I was there.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And did he search for you, and could not find you?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You shall hear. As good luck would have it, comes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in one Mistress Page; gives intelligence of Ford's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: approach; and, in her invention and Ford's wife's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: distraction, they conveyed me into a buck-basket.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: A buck-basket!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the Lord, a buck-basket! rammed me in with foul

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shirts and smocks, socks, foul stockings, greasy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: napkins; that, Master Brook, there was the rankest

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: compound of villanous smell that ever offended nostril.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And how long lay you there?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Nay, you shall hear, Master Brook, what I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: suffered to bring this woman to evil for your good.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Being thus crammed in the basket, a couple of Ford's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: knaves, his hinds, were called forth by their

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: mistress to carry me in the name of foul clothes to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Datchet-lane: they took me on their shoulders; met

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the jealous knave their master in the door, who

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: asked them once or twice what they had in their

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: basket: I quaked for fear, lest the lunatic knave

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: would have searched it; but fate, ordaining he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: should be a cuckold, held his hand. Well: on went he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: for a search, and away went I for foul clothes. But

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: mark the sequel, Master Brook: I suffered the pangs

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of three several deaths; first, an intolerable

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fright, to be detected with a jealous rotten

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bell-wether; next, to be compassed, like a good

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bilbo, in the circumference of a peck, hilt to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: point, heel to head; and then, to be stopped in,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: like a strong distillation, with stinking clothes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that fretted in their own grease: think of that,--a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: man of my kidney,--think of that,--that am as subject

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to heat as butter; a man of continual dissolution

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and thaw: it was a miracle to scape suffocation.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And in the height of this bath, when I was more than

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: half stewed in grease, like a Dutch dish, to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thrown into the Thames, and cooled, glowing hot,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in that surge, like a horse-shoe; think of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that,--hissing hot,--think of that, Master Brook.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: In good sadness, I am sorry that for my sake you

speaker: FORD
text_entry: have sufferd all this. My suit then is desperate;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: you'll undertake her no more?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Master Brook, I will be thrown into Etna, as I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: been into Thames, ere I will leave her thus. Her

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: husband is this morning gone a-birding: I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: received from her another embassy of meeting; 'twixt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: eight and nine is the hour, Master Brook.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: 'Tis past eight already, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Is it? I will then address me to my appointment.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Come to me at your convenient leisure, and you shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: know how I speed; and the conclusion shall be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: crowned with your enjoying her. Adieu. You shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have her, Master Brook; Master Brook, you shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cuckold Ford.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Hum! ha! is this a vision? is this a dream? do I

speaker: FORD
text_entry: sleep? Master Ford awake! awake, Master Ford!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: there's a hole made in your best coat, Master Ford.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: This 'tis to be married! this 'tis to have linen

speaker: FORD
text_entry: and buck-baskets! Well, I will proclaim myself

speaker: FORD
text_entry: what I am: I will now take the lecher; he is at my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: house; he cannot 'scape me; 'tis impossible he

speaker: FORD
text_entry: should; he cannot creep into a halfpenny purse,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: nor into a pepper-box: but, lest the devil that

speaker: FORD
text_entry: guides him should aid him, I will search

speaker: FORD
text_entry: impossible places. Though what I am I cannot avoid,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: yet to be what I would not shall not make me tame:

speaker: FORD
text_entry: if I have horns to make one mad, let the proverb go

speaker: FORD
text_entry: with me: I'll be horn-mad.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: FORD
text_entry: SCENE I. A street.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS QUICKLY, and WILLIAM PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Is he at Master Ford's already, think'st thou?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Sure he is by this, or will be presently: but,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: truly, he is very courageous mad about his throwing

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: into the water. Mistress Ford desires you to come suddenly.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I'll be with her by and by; I'll but bring my young

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: man here to school. Look, where his master comes;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: 'tis a playing-day, I see.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: How now, Sir Hugh! no school to-day?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: No; Master Slender is let the boys leave to play.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Blessing of his heart!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Sir Hugh, my husband says my son profits nothing in

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: the world at his book. I pray you, ask him some

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: questions in his accidence.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Come hither, William; hold up your head; come.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come on, sirrah; hold up your head; answer your

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: master, be not afraid.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: William, how many numbers is in nouns?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Two.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Truly, I thought there had been one number more,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: because they say, ''Od's nouns.'

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Peace your tattlings! What is 'fair,' William?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Pulcher.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Polecats! there are fairer things than polecats, sure.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: You are a very simplicity 'oman: I pray you peace.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: What is 'lapis,' William?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: A stone.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And what is 'a stone,' William?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: A pebble.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: No, it is 'lapis:' I pray you, remember in your prain.

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Lapis.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: That is a good William. What is he, William, that

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: does lend articles?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Articles are borrowed of the pronoun, and be thus

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: declined, Singulariter, nominativo, hic, haec, hoc.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Nominativo, hig, hag, hog; pray you, mark:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: genitivo, hujus. Well, what is your accusative case?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Accusativo, hinc.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I pray you, have your remembrance, child,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: accusative, hung, hang, hog.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: 'Hang-hog' is Latin for bacon, I warrant you.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Leave your prabbles, 'oman. What is the focative

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: case, William?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: O,--vocativo, O.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Remember, William; focative is caret.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And that's a good root.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Oman, forbear.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Peace!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: What is your genitive case plural, William?

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Genitive case!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Ay.

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Genitive,--horum, harum, horum.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Vengeance of Jenny's case! fie on her! never name

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: her, child, if she be a whore.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: For shame, 'oman.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: You do ill to teach the child such words: he

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: teaches him to hick and to hack, which they'll do

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: fast enough of themselves, and to call 'horum:' fie upon you!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Oman, art thou lunatics? hast thou no

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: understandings for thy cases and the numbers of the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: genders? Thou art as foolish Christian creatures as

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I would desires.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Prithee, hold thy peace.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Show me now, William, some declensions of your pronouns.

speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
text_entry: Forsooth, I have forgot.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: It is qui, quae, quod: if you forget your 'quies,'

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: your 'quaes,' and your 'quods,' you must be

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: preeches. Go your ways, and play; go.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: He is a better scholar than I thought he was.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: He is a good sprag memory. Farewell, Mistress Page.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Adieu, good Sir Hugh.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Get you home, boy. Come, we stay too long.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: SCENE II. A room in FORD'S house.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF and MISTRESS FORD

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mistress Ford, your sorrow hath eaten up my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sufferance. I see you are obsequious in your love,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and I profess requital to a hair's breadth; not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: only, Mistress Ford, in the simple

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: office of love, but in all the accoutrement,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: complement and ceremony of it. But are you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sure of your husband now?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: He's a-birding, sweet Sir John.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: [Within]  What, ho, gossip Ford! what, ho!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Step into the chamber, Sir John.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exit FALSTAFF

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: How now, sweetheart! who's at home besides yourself?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, none but mine own people.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Indeed!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: No, certainly.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Aside to her

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Speak louder.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Truly, I am so glad you have nobody here.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, woman, your husband is in his old lunes again:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: he so takes on yonder with my husband; so rails

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: against all married mankind; so curses all Eve's

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: daughters, of what complexion soever; and so buffets

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: himself on the forehead, crying, 'Peer out, peer

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: out!' that any madness I ever yet beheld seemed but

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: tameness, civility and patience, to this his

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: distemper he is in now: I am glad the fat knight is not here.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, does he talk of him?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Of none but him; and swears he was carried out, the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: last time he searched for him, in a basket; protests

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to my husband he is now here, and hath drawn him and

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: the rest of their company from their sport, to make

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: another experiment of his suspicion: but I am glad

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: the knight is not here; now he shall see his own foolery.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: How near is he, Mistress Page?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Hard by; at street end; he will be here anon.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I am undone! The knight is here.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why then you are utterly shamed, and he's but a dead

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: man. What a woman are you!--Away with him, away

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: with him! better shame than murder.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Which way should be go? how should I bestow him?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Shall I put him into the basket again?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Re-enter FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No, I'll come no more i' the basket. May I not go

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: out ere he come?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Alas, three of Master Ford's brothers watch the door

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: with pistols, that none shall issue out; otherwise

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: you might slip away ere he came. But what make you here?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What shall I do? I'll creep up into the chimney.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: There they always use to discharge their

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: birding-pieces. Creep into the kiln-hole.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Where is it?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: He will seek there, on my word. Neither press,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: coffer, chest, trunk, well, vault, but he hath an

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: abstract for the remembrance of such places, and

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: goes to them by his note: there is no hiding you in the house.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll go out then.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: If you go out in your own semblance, you die, Sir

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: John. Unless you go out disguised--

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: How might we disguise him?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Alas the day, I know not! There is no woman's gown

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: big enough for him otherwise he might put on a hat,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: a muffler and a kerchief, and so escape.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Good hearts, devise something: any extremity rather

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: than a mischief.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: My maid's aunt, the fat woman of Brentford, has a

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: gown above.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: On my word, it will serve him; she's as big as he

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: is: and there's her thrummed hat and her muffler

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: too. Run up, Sir John.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Go, go, sweet Sir John: Mistress Page and I will

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: look some linen for your head.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Quick, quick! we'll come dress you straight: put

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: on the gown the while.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit FALSTAFF

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I would my husband would meet him in this shape: he

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: cannot abide the old woman of Brentford; he swears

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: she's a witch; forbade her my house and hath

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: threatened to beat her.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Heaven guide him to thy husband's cudgel, and the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: devil guide his cudgel afterwards!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: But is my husband coming?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Ah, in good sadness, is he; and talks of the basket

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: too, howsoever he hath had intelligence.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: We'll try that; for I'll appoint my men to carry the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: basket again, to meet him at the door with it, as

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: they did last time.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Nay, but he'll be here presently: let's go dress him

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: like the witch of Brentford.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I'll first direct my men what they shall do with the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: basket. Go up; I'll bring linen for him straight.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Hang him, dishonest varlet! we cannot misuse him enough.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We'll leave a proof, by that which we will do,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Wives may be merry, and yet honest too:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We do not act that often jest and laugh;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: 'Tis old, but true, Still swine eat all the draff.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Re-enter MISTRESS FORD with two Servants

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Go, sirs, take the basket again on your shoulders:

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: your master is hard at door; if he bid you set it

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: down, obey him: quickly, dispatch.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Come, come, take it up.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Pray heaven it be not full of knight again.

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: I hope not; I had as lief bear so much lead.

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Enter FORD, PAGE, SHALLOW, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ay, but if it prove true, Master Page, have you any

speaker: FORD
text_entry: way then to unfool me again? Set down the basket,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: villain! Somebody call my wife. Youth in a basket!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: O you panderly rascals! there's a knot, a ging, a

speaker: FORD
text_entry: pack, a conspiracy against me: now shall the devil

speaker: FORD
text_entry: be shamed. What, wife, I say! Come, come forth!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Behold what honest clothes you send forth to bleaching!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why, this passes, Master Ford; you are not to go

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: loose any longer; you must be pinioned.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Why, this is lunatics! this is mad as a mad dog!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Indeed, Master Ford, this is not well, indeed.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: So say I too, sir.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Re-enter MISTRESS FORD

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Come hither, Mistress Ford; Mistress Ford the honest

speaker: FORD
text_entry: woman, the modest wife, the virtuous creature, that

speaker: FORD
text_entry: hath the jealous fool to her husband! I suspect

speaker: FORD
text_entry: without cause, mistress, do I?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Heaven be my witness you do, if you suspect me in

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: any dishonesty.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well said, brazen-face! hold it out. Come forth, sirrah!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pulling clothes out of the basket

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: This passes!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Are you not ashamed? let the clothes alone.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I shall find you anon.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Tis unreasonable! Will you take up your wife's

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: clothes? Come away.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Empty the basket, I say!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, man, why?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Master Page, as I am a man, there was one conveyed

speaker: FORD
text_entry: out of my house yesterday in this basket: why may

speaker: FORD
text_entry: not he be there again? In my house I am sure he is:

speaker: FORD
text_entry: my intelligence is true; my jealousy is reasonable.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pluck me out all the linen.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: If you find a man there, he shall die a flea's death.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Here's no man.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: By my fidelity, this is not well, Master Ford; this

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: wrongs you.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Master Ford, you must pray, and not follow the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: imaginations of your own heart: this is jealousies.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well, he's not here I seek for.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: No, nor nowhere else but in your brain.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Help to search my house this one time. If I find

speaker: FORD
text_entry: not what I seek, show no colour for my extremity; let

speaker: FORD
text_entry: me for ever be your table-sport; let them say of

speaker: FORD
text_entry: me, 'As jealous as Ford, Chat searched a hollow

speaker: FORD
text_entry: walnut for his wife's leman.' Satisfy me once more;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: once more search with me.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What, ho, Mistress Page! come you and the old woman

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: down; my husband will come into the chamber.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Old woman! what old woman's that?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, it is my maid's aunt of Brentford.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: A witch, a quean, an old cozening quean! Have I not

speaker: FORD
text_entry: forbid her my house? She comes of errands, does

speaker: FORD
text_entry: she? We are simple men; we do not know what's

speaker: FORD
text_entry: brought to pass under the profession of

speaker: FORD
text_entry: fortune-telling. She works by charms, by spells,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: by the figure, and such daubery as this is, beyond

speaker: FORD
text_entry: our element we know nothing. Come down, you witch,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: you hag, you; come down, I say!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, good, sweet husband! Good gentlemen, let him

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: not strike the old woman.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Re-enter FALSTAFF in woman's clothes, and MISTRESS PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come, Mother Prat; come, give me your hand.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I'll prat her.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Beating him

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Out of my door, you witch, you hag, you baggage, you

speaker: FORD
text_entry: polecat, you runyon! out, out! I'll conjure you,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I'll fortune-tell you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exit FALSTAFF

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Are you not ashamed? I think you have killed the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: poor woman.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, he will do it. 'Tis a goodly credit for you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Hang her, witch!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: By the yea and no, I think the 'oman is a witch

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: indeed: I like not when a 'oman has a great peard;

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I spy a great peard under his muffler.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Will you follow, gentlemen? I beseech you, follow;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: see but the issue of my jealousy: if I cry out thus

speaker: FORD
text_entry: upon no trail, never trust me when I open again.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Let's obey his humour a little further: come,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: gentlemen.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt FORD, PAGE, SHALLOW, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Trust me, he beat him most pitifully.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, by the mass, that he did not; he beat him most

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: unpitifully, methought.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I'll have the cudgel hallowed and hung o'er the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: altar; it hath done meritorious service.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: What think you? may we, with the warrant of

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: womanhood and the witness of a good conscience,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: pursue him with any further revenge?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The spirit of wantonness is, sure, scared out of

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: him: if the devil have him not in fee-simple, with

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: fine and recovery, he will never, I think, in the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: way of waste, attempt us again.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Shall we tell our husbands how we have served him?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Yes, by all means; if it be but to scrape the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
