text_entry: figures out of your husband's brains. If they can

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: find in their hearts the poor unvirtuous fat knight

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: shall be any further afflicted, we two will still be

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: the ministers.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I'll warrant they'll have him publicly shamed: and

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: methinks there would be no period to the jest,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: should he not be publicly shamed.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come, to the forge with it then; shape it: I would

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: not have things cool.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter Host and BARDOLPH

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Sir, the Germans desire to have three of your

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: horses: the duke himself will be to-morrow at

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: court, and they are going to meet him.

speaker: Host
text_entry: What duke should that be comes so secretly? I hear

speaker: Host
text_entry: not of him in the court. Let me speak with the

speaker: Host
text_entry: gentlemen: they speak English?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Ay, sir; I'll call them to you.

speaker: Host
text_entry: They shall have my horses; but I'll make them pay;

speaker: Host
text_entry: I'll sauce them: they have had my house a week at

speaker: Host
text_entry: command; I have turned away my other guests: they

speaker: Host
text_entry: must come off; I'll sauce them. Come.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: Host
text_entry: SCENE IV. A room in FORD'S house.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Enter PAGE, FORD, MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Tis one of the best discretions of a 'oman as ever

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I did look upon.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And did he send you both these letters at an instant?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Within a quarter of an hour.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Pardon me, wife. Henceforth do what thou wilt;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I rather will suspect the sun with cold

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Than thee with wantonness: now doth thy honour stand

speaker: FORD
text_entry: In him that was of late an heretic,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: As firm as faith.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'Tis well, 'tis well; no more:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Be not as extreme in submission

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: As in offence.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: But let our plot go forward: let our wives

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yet once again, to make us public sport,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Appoint a meeting with this old fat fellow,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Where we may take him and disgrace him for it.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: There is no better way than that they spoke of.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How? to send him word they'll meet him in the park

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: at midnight? Fie, fie! he'll never come.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: You say he has been thrown in the rivers and has

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: been grievously peaten as an old 'oman: methinks

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: there should be terrors in him that he should not

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: come; methinks his flesh is punished, he shall have

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: no desires.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: So think I too.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Devise but how you'll use him when he comes,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: And let us two devise to bring him thither.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: There is an old tale goes that Herne the hunter,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Sometime a keeper here in Windsor forest,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Doth all the winter-time, at still midnight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Walk round about an oak, with great ragg'd horns;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And there he blasts the tree and takes the cattle

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And makes milch-kine yield blood and shakes a chain

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: In a most hideous and dreadful manner:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You have heard of such a spirit, and well you know

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The superstitious idle-headed eld

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Received and did deliver to our age

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: This tale of Herne the hunter for a truth.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why, yet there want not many that do fear

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: In deep of night to walk by this Herne's oak:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: But what of this?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Marry, this is our device;

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: That Falstaff at that oak shall meet with us.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Well, let it not be doubted but he'll come:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And in this shape when you have brought him thither,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: What shall be done with him? what is your plot?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: That likewise have we thought upon, and thus:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Nan Page my daughter and my little son

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And three or four more of their growth we'll dress

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Like urchins, ouphes and fairies, green and white,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: With rounds of waxen tapers on their heads,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And rattles in their hands: upon a sudden,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: As Falstaff, she and I, are newly met,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Let them from forth a sawpit rush at once

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: With some diffused song: upon their sight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We two in great amazedness will fly:

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Then let them all encircle him about

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And, fairy-like, to-pinch the unclean knight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And ask him why, that hour of fairy revel,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: In their so sacred paths he dares to tread

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: In shape profane.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: And till he tell the truth,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Let the supposed fairies pinch him sound

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: And burn him with their tapers.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The truth being known,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: We'll all present ourselves, dis-horn the spirit,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And mock him home to Windsor.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: The children must

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Be practised well to this, or they'll ne'er do't.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I will teach the children their behaviors; and I

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: will be like a jack-an-apes also, to burn the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: knight with my taber.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: That will be excellent. I'll go and buy them vizards.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: My Nan shall be the queen of all the fairies,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Finely attired in a robe of white.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: That silk will I go buy.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Aside

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And in that time

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Shall Master Slender steal my Nan away

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And marry her at Eton. Go send to Falstaff straight.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Nay I'll to him again in name of Brook

speaker: FORD
text_entry: He'll tell me all his purpose: sure, he'll come.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Fear not you that. Go get us properties

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And tricking for our fairies.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Let us about it: it is admirable pleasures and fery

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: honest knaveries.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt PAGE, FORD, and SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Go, Mistress Ford,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Send quickly to Sir John, to know his mind.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit MISTRESS FORD

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I'll to the doctor: he hath my good will,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And none but he, to marry with Nan Page.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: That Slender, though well landed, is an idiot;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And he my husband best of all affects.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: The doctor is well money'd, and his friends

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Potent at court: he, none but he, shall have her,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Though twenty thousand worthier come to crave her.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: SCENE V. A room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter Host and SIMPLE

speaker: Host
text_entry: What wouldst thou have, boor? what: thick-skin?

speaker: Host
text_entry: speak, breathe, discuss; brief, short, quick, snap.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Marry, sir, I come to speak with Sir John Falstaff

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: from Master Slender.

speaker: Host
text_entry: There's his chamber, his house, his castle, his

speaker: Host
text_entry: standing-bed and truckle-bed; 'tis painted about

speaker: Host
text_entry: with the story of the Prodigal, fresh and new. Go

speaker: Host
text_entry: knock and call; hell speak like an Anthropophaginian

speaker: Host
text_entry: unto thee: knock, I say.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: There's an old woman, a fat woman, gone up into his

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: chamber: I'll be so bold as stay, sir, till she come

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: down; I come to speak with her, indeed.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Ha! a fat woman! the knight may be robbed: I'll

speaker: Host
text_entry: call. Bully knight! bully Sir John! speak from

speaker: Host
text_entry: thy lungs military: art thou there? it is thine

speaker: Host
text_entry: host, thine Ephesian, calls.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: [Above]  How now, mine host!

speaker: Host
text_entry: Here's a Bohemian-Tartar tarries the coming down of

speaker: Host
text_entry: thy fat woman. Let her descend, bully, let her

speaker: Host
text_entry: descend; my chambers are honourable: fie! privacy?

speaker: Host
text_entry: fie!

speaker: Host
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: There was, mine host, an old fat woman even now with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me;  but she's gone.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Pray you, sir, was't not the wise woman of

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Brentford?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ay, marry, was it, mussel-shell: what would you with her?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: My master, sir, Master Slender, sent to her, seeing

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: her go through the streets, to know, sir, whether

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: one Nym, sir, that beguiled him of a chain, had the

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: chain or no.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I spake with the old woman about it.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: And what says she, I pray, sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Marry, she says that the very same man that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: beguiled Master Slender of his chain cozened him of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: I would I could have spoken with the woman herself;

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: I had other things to have spoken with her too from

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What are they? let us know.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Ay, come; quick.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: I may not conceal them, sir.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Conceal them, or thou diest.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Why, sir, they were nothing but about Mistress Anne

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Page; to know if it were my master's fortune to

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: have her or no.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: 'Tis, 'tis his fortune.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: What, sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: To have her, or no. Go; say the woman told me so.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: May I be bold to say so, sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ay, sir; like who more bold.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: I thank your worship: I shall make my master glad

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: with these tidings.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Host
text_entry: Thou art clerkly, thou art clerkly, Sir John. Was

speaker: Host
text_entry: there a wise woman with thee?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ay, that there was, mine host; one that hath taught

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me more wit than ever I learned before in my life;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and I paid nothing for it neither, but was paid for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: my learning.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter BARDOLPH

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Out, alas, sir! cozenage, mere cozenage!

speaker: Host
text_entry: Where be my horses? speak well of them, varletto.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Run away with the cozeners; for so soon as I came

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: beyond Eton, they threw me off from behind one of

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: them, in a slough of mire; and set spurs and away,

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: like three German devils, three Doctor Faustuses.

speaker: Host
text_entry: They are gone but to meet the duke, villain: do not

speaker: Host
text_entry: say they be fled; Germans are honest men.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Where is mine host?

speaker: Host
text_entry: What is the matter, sir?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Have a care of your entertainments: there is a

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: friend of mine come to town tells me there is three

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: cozen-germans that has cozened all the hosts of

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Readins, of Maidenhead, of Colebrook, of horses and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: money. I tell you for good will, look you: you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: are wise and full of gibes and vlouting-stocks, and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'tis not convenient you should be cozened. Fare you well.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter DOCTOR CAIUS

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vere is mine host de Jarteer?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Here, master doctor, in perplexity and doubtful dilemma.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I cannot tell vat is dat: but it is tell-a me dat

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: you make grand preparation for a duke de Jamany: by

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: my trot, dere is no duke dat the court is know to

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: come. I tell you for good vill: adieu.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hue and cry, villain, go! Assist me, knight. I am

speaker: Host
text_entry: undone! Fly, run, hue and cry, villain! I am undone!

speaker: Host
text_entry: Exeunt Host and BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I would all the world might be cozened; for I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: been cozened and beaten too. If it should come to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the ear of the court, how I have been transformed

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and how my transformation hath been washed and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cudgelled, they would melt me out of my fat drop by

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: drop and liquor fishermen's boots with me; I warrant

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: they would whip me with their fine wits till I were

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: as crest-fallen as a dried pear. I never prospered

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: since I forswore myself at primero. Well, if my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: wind were but long enough to say my prayers, I would repent.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, whence come you?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: From the two parties, forsooth.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: The devil take one party and his dam the other! and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: so they shall be both bestowed. I have suffered more

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: for their sakes, more than the villanous inconstancy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of man's disposition is able to bear.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And have not they suffered? Yes, I warrant;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: speciously one of them; Mistress Ford, good heart,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: is beaten black and blue, that you cannot see a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: white spot about her.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What tellest thou me of black and blue? I was

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: beaten myself into all the colours of the rainbow;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and I was like to be apprehended for the witch of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Brentford: but that my admirable dexterity of wit,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: my counterfeiting the action of an old woman,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: delivered me, the knave constable had set me i' the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: stocks, i' the common stocks, for a witch.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Sir, let me speak with you in your chamber: you

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: shall hear how things go; and, I warrant, to your

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: content. Here is a letter will say somewhat. Good

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: hearts, what ado here is to bring you together!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Sure, one of you does not serve heaven well, that

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: you are so crossed.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Come up into my chamber.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: SCENE VI. Another room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter FENTON and Host

speaker: Host
text_entry: Master Fenton, talk not to me; my mind is heavy: I

speaker: Host
text_entry: will give over all.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Yet hear me speak. Assist me in my purpose,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And, as I am a gentleman, I'll give thee

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: A hundred pound in gold more than your loss.

speaker: Host
text_entry: I will hear you, Master Fenton; and I will at the

speaker: Host
text_entry: least keep your counsel.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: From time to time I have acquainted you

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: With the dear love I bear to fair Anne Page;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Who mutually hath answer'd my affection,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: So far forth as herself might be her chooser,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Even to my wish: I have a letter from her

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Of such contents as you will wonder at;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The mirth whereof so larded with my matter,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: That neither singly can be manifested,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Without the show of both; fat Falstaff

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Hath a great scene: the image of the jest

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: I'll show you here at large. Hark, good mine host.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: To-night at Herne's oak, just 'twixt twelve and one,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Must my sweet Nan present the Fairy Queen;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The purpose why, is here: in which disguise,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: While other jests are something rank on foot,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Her father hath commanded her to slip

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Away with Slender and with him at Eton

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Immediately to marry: she hath consented: Now, sir,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Her mother, ever strong against that match

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And firm for Doctor Caius, hath appointed

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: That he shall likewise shuffle her away,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: While other sports are tasking of their minds,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And at the deanery, where a priest attends,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Straight marry her: to this her mother's plot

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: She seemingly obedient likewise hath

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Made promise to the doctor. Now, thus it rests:

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Her father means she shall be all in white,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And in that habit, when Slender sees his time

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: To take her by the hand and bid her go,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: She shall go with him: her mother hath intended,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The better to denote her to the doctor,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: For they must all be mask'd and vizarded,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: That quaint in green she shall be loose enrobed,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: With ribands pendent, flaring 'bout her head;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And when the doctor spies his vantage ripe,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: To pinch her by the hand, and, on that token,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The maid hath given consent to go with him.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Which means she to deceive, father or mother?

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Both, my good host, to go along with me:

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And here it rests, that you'll procure the vicar

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: To stay for me at church 'twixt twelve and one,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And, in the lawful name of marrying,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: To give our hearts united ceremony.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Well, husband your device; I'll to the vicar:

speaker: Host
text_entry: Bring you the maid, you shall not lack a priest.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: So shall I evermore be bound to thee;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Besides, I'll make a present recompense.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in the Garter Inn.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF and MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Prithee, no more prattling; go. I'll hold. This is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the third time; I hope good luck lies in odd

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: numbers. Away I go. They say there is divinity in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: odd numbers, either in nativity, chance, or death. Away!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: I'll provide you a chain; and I'll do what I can to

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: get you a pair of horns.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Away, I say; time wears: hold up your head, and mince.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter FORD

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How now, Master Brook! Master Brook, the matter

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: will be known to-night, or never. Be you in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Park about midnight, at Herne's oak, and you shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: see wonders.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Went you not to her yesterday, sir, as you told me

speaker: FORD
text_entry: you had appointed?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I went to her, Master Brook, as you see, like a poor

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: old man: but I came from her, Master Brook, like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: poor old woman. That same knave Ford, her husband,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hath the finest mad devil of jealousy in him,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Master Brook, that ever governed frenzy. I will tell

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: you: he beat me grievously, in the shape of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: woman; for in the shape of man, Master Brook, I fear

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not Goliath with a weaver's beam; because I know

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: also life is a shuttle. I am in haste; go along

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: with me: I'll tell you all, Master Brook. Since I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: plucked geese, played truant and whipped top, I knew

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not what 'twas to be beaten till lately. Follow

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me: I'll tell you strange things of this knave

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ford, on whom to-night I will be revenged, and I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: will deliver his wife into your hand. Follow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Strange things in hand, Master Brook! Follow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: SCENE II. Windsor Park.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Come, come; we'll couch i' the castle-ditch till we

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: see the light of our fairies. Remember, son Slender,

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: my daughter.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Ay, forsooth; I have spoke with her and we have a

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: nay-word how to know one another: I come to her in

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: white, and cry 'mum;' she cries 'budget;' and by

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: that we know one another.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: That's good too: but what needs either your 'mum'

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: or her 'budget?' the white will decipher her well

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: enough. It hath struck ten o'clock.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: The night is dark; light and spirits will become it

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: well. Heaven prosper our sport! No man means evil

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: but the devil, and we shall know him by his horns.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Let's away; follow me.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: SCENE III. A street leading to the Park.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD, and DOCTOR CAIUS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Master doctor, my daughter is in green: when you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: see your time, take her by the band, away with her

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to the deanery, and dispatch it quickly. Go before

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: into the Park: we two must go together.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I know vat I have to do. Adieu.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Fare you well, sir.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exit DOCTOR CAIUS

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: My husband will not rejoice so much at the abuse of

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Falstaff as he will chafe at the doctor's marrying

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: my daughter: but 'tis no matter; better a little

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: chiding than a great deal of heart-break.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Where is Nan now and her troop of fairies, and the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Welsh devil Hugh?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: They are all couched in a pit hard by Herne's oak,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: with obscured lights; which, at the very instant of

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Falstaff's and our meeting, they will at once

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: display to the night.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: That cannot choose but amaze him.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: If he be not amazed, he will be mocked; if he be

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: amazed, he will every way be mocked.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: We'll betray him finely.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Against such lewdsters and their lechery

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Those that betray them do no treachery.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: The hour draws on. To the oak, to the oak!

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: SCENE IV. Windsor Park.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS, disguised, with others as Fairies

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Trib, trib, fairies; come; and remember your parts:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: be pold, I pray you; follow me into the pit; and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: when I give the watch-'ords, do as I pid you:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: come, come; trib, trib.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the Park.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF disguised as Herne

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: The Windsor bell hath struck twelve; the minute

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: draws on. Now, the hot-blooded gods assist me!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Remember, Jove, thou wast a bull for thy Europa; love

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: set on thy horns. O powerful love! that, in some

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: respects, makes a beast a man, in some other, a man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a beast. You were also, Jupiter, a swan for the love

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of Leda. O omnipotent Love! how near the god drew

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to the complexion of a goose! A fault done first in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the form of a beast. O Jove, a beastly fault! And

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: then another fault in the semblance of a fowl; think

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: on 't, Jove; a foul fault! When gods have hot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: backs, what shall poor men do? For me, I am here a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Windsor stag; and the fattest, I think, i' the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forest. Send me a cool rut-time, Jove, or who can

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: blame me to piss my tallow? Who comes here? my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: doe?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Sir John! art thou there, my deer? my male deer?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: My doe with the black scut! Let the sky rain

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: potatoes; let it thunder to the tune of Green

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sleeves, hail kissing-comfits and snow eringoes; let

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: there come a tempest of provocation, I will shelter me here.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Mistress Page is come with me, sweetheart.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Divide me like a bribe buck, each a haunch: I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: keep my sides to myself, my shoulders for the fellow

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of this walk, and my horns I bequeath your husbands.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Am I a woodman, ha? Speak I like Herne the hunter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, now is Cupid a child of conscience; he makes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: restitution. As I am a true spirit, welcome!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Noise within

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Alas, what noise?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Heaven forgive our sins

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What should this be?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Away, away!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: They run off

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I think the devil will not have me damned, lest the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: oil that's in me should set hell on fire; he would

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: never else cross me thus.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS, disguised as before; PISTOL,  as Hobgoblin; MISTRESS QUICKLY, ANNE PAGE, and others, as Fairies, with tapers

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fairies, black, grey, green, and white,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: You moonshine revellers and shades of night,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: You orphan heirs of fixed destiny,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Attend your office and your quality.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Crier Hobgoblin, make the fairy oyes.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Elves, list your names; silence, you airy toys.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Cricket, to Windsor chimneys shalt thou leap:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Where fires thou find'st unraked and hearths unswept,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: There pinch the maids as blue as bilberry:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Our radiant queen hates sluts and sluttery.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: They are fairies; he that speaks to them shall die:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll wink and couch: no man their works must eye.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Lies down upon his face

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Where's Bede? Go you, and where you find a maid

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: That, ere she sleep, has thrice her prayers said,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Raise up the organs of her fantasy;

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sleep she as sound as careless infancy:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: But those as sleep and think not on their sins,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pinch them, arms, legs, backs, shoulders, sides and shins.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: About, about;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Search Windsor Castle, elves, within and out:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Strew good luck, ouphes, on every sacred room:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: That it may stand till the perpetual doom,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: In state as wholesome as in state 'tis fit,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Worthy the owner, and the owner it.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: The several chairs of order look you scour

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: With juice of balm and every precious flower:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Each fair instalment, coat, and several crest,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: With loyal blazon, evermore be blest!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And nightly, meadow-fairies, look you sing,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Like to the Garter's compass, in a ring:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: The expressure that it bears, green let it be,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: More fertile-fresh than all the field to see;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And 'Honi soit qui mal y pense' write

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: In emerald tufts, flowers purple, blue and white;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Let sapphire, pearl and rich embroidery,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Buckled below fair knighthood's bending knee:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fairies use flowers for their charactery.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Away; disperse: but till 'tis one o'clock,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Our dance of custom round about the oak

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Of Herne the hunter, let us not forget.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pray you, lock hand in hand; yourselves in order set

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And twenty glow-worms shall our lanterns be,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To guide our measure round about the tree.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: But, stay; I smell a man of middle-earth.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Heavens defend me from that Welsh fairy, lest he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: transform me to a piece of cheese!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Vile worm, thou wast o'erlook'd even in thy birth.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: With trial-fire touch me his finger-end:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: If he be chaste, the flame will back descend

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And turn him to no pain; but if he start,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: It is the flesh of a corrupted heart.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: A trial, come.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Come, will this wood take fire?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: They burn him with their tapers

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Oh, Oh, Oh!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Corrupt, corrupt, and tainted in desire!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: About him, fairies; sing a scornful rhyme;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And, as you trip, still pinch him to your time.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: SONG.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fie on sinful fantasy!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fie on lust and luxury!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Lust is but a bloody fire,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Kindled with unchaste desire,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fed in heart, whose flames aspire

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: As thoughts do blow them, higher and higher.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Pinch him, fairies, mutually;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Pinch him for his villany;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Pinch him, and burn him, and turn him about,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Till candles and starlight and moonshine be out.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: During this song they pinch FALSTAFF. DOCTOR CAIUS  comes one way, and steals away a boy in green;  SLENDER another way, and takes off a boy in white;  and FENTON comes and steals away ANN PAGE.  A noise of hunting is heard within. All the  Fairies run away. FALSTAFF pulls off his buck's head, and rises

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter PAGE, FORD, MISTRESS PAGE, and MISTRESS FORD

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Nay, do not fly; I think we have watch'd you now

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Will none but Herne the hunter serve your turn?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I pray you, come, hold up the jest no higher

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Now, good Sir John, how like you Windsor wives?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: See you these, husband? do not these fair yokes

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Become the forest better than the town?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Now, sir, who's a cuckold now? Master Brook,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Falstaff's a knave, a cuckoldly knave; here are his

speaker: FORD
text_entry: horns, Master Brook: and, Master Brook, he hath

speaker: FORD
text_entry: enjoyed nothing of Ford's but his buck-basket, his

speaker: FORD
text_entry: cudgel, and twenty pounds of money, which must be

speaker: FORD
text_entry: paid to Master Brook; his horses are arrested for

speaker: FORD
text_entry: it, Master Brook.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Sir John, we have had ill luck; we could never meet.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I will never take you for my love again; but I will

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: always count you my deer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I do begin to perceive that I am made an ass.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ay, and an ox too: both the proofs are extant.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And these are not fairies? I was three or four

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: times in the thought they were not fairies: and yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the guiltiness of my mind, the sudden surprise of my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: powers, drove the grossness of the foppery into a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: received belief, in despite of the teeth of all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rhyme and reason, that they were fairies. See now

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: how wit may be made a Jack-a-Lent, when 'tis upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ill employment!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sir John Falstaff, serve Got, and leave your

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: desires, and fairies will not pinse you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well said, fairy Hugh.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And leave your jealousies too, I pray you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will never mistrust my wife again till thou art

speaker: FORD
text_entry: able to woo her in good English.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have I laid my brain in the sun and dried it, that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it wants matter to prevent so gross o'erreaching as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: this? Am I ridden with a Welsh goat too? shall I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have a coxcomb of frize? 'Tis time I were choked

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: with a piece of toasted cheese.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Seese is not good to give putter; your belly is all putter.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: 'Seese' and 'putter'! have I lived to stand at the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: taunt of one that makes fritters of English? This

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: is enough to be the decay of lust and late-walking

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: through the realm.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why Sir John, do you think, though we would have the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: virtue out of our hearts by the head and shoulders

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and have given ourselves without scruple to hell,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: that ever the devil could have made you our delight?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: What, a hodge-pudding? a bag of flax?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: A puffed man?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Old, cold, withered and of intolerable entrails?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And one that is as slanderous as Satan?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And as poor as Job?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And as wicked as his wife?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And given to fornications, and to taverns and sack

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and wine and metheglins, and to drinkings and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: swearings and starings, pribbles and prabbles?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, I am your theme: you have the start of me; I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: am dejected; I am not able to answer the Welsh

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: flannel; ignorance itself is a plummet o'er me: use

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me as you will.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Marry, sir, we'll bring you to Windsor, to one

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Master Brook, that you have cozened of money, to

speaker: FORD
text_entry: whom you should have been a pander: over and above

speaker: FORD
text_entry: that you have suffered, I think to repay that money

speaker: FORD
text_entry: will be a biting affliction.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yet be cheerful, knight: thou shalt eat a posset

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: to-night at my house; where I will desire thee to

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: laugh at my wife, that now laughs at thee: tell her

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Master Slender hath married her daughter.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: [Aside]  Doctors doubt that: if Anne Page be my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: daughter, she is, by this, Doctor Caius' wife.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter SLENDER

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Whoa ho! ho, father Page!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Son, how now! how now, son! have you dispatched?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Dispatched! I'll make the best in Gloucestershire

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: know on't; would I were hanged, la, else.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Of what, son?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I came yonder at Eton to marry Mistress Anne Page,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: and she's a great lubberly boy. If it had not been

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: i' the church, I would have swinged him, or he

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: should have swinged me. If I did not think it had

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: been Anne Page, would I might never stir!--and 'tis

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: a postmaster's boy.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Upon my life, then, you took the wrong.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: What need you tell me that? I think so, when I took

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: a boy for a girl. If I had been married to him, for

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: all he was in woman's apparel, I would not have had

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: him.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why, this is your own folly. Did not I tell you how

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: you should know my daughter by her garments?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I went to her in white, and cried 'mum,' and she

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: cried 'budget,' as Anne and I had appointed; and yet

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: it was not Anne, but a postmaster's boy.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Good George, be not angry: I knew of your purpose;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: turned my daughter into green; and, indeed, she is

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: now with the doctor at the deanery, and there married.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter DOCTOR CAIUS

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vere is Mistress Page? By gar, I am cozened: I ha'

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: married un garcon, a boy; un paysan, by gar, a boy;

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: it is not Anne Page: by gar, I am cozened.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, did you take her in green?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ay, by gar, and 'tis a boy: by gar, I'll raise all Windsor.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: This is strange. Who hath got the right Anne?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: My heart misgives me: here comes Master Fenton.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter FENTON and ANNE PAGE

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Master Fenton!

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Pardon, good father! good my mother, pardon!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Now, mistress, how chance you went not with Master Slender?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why went you not with master doctor, maid?

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: You do amaze her: hear the truth of it.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: You would have married her most shamefully,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Where there was no proportion held in love.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The truth is, she and I, long since contracted,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Are now so sure that nothing can dissolve us.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The offence is holy that she hath committed;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And this deceit loses the name of craft,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Of disobedience, or unduteous title,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Since therein she doth evitate and shun

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: A thousand irreligious cursed hours,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Which forced marriage would have brought upon her.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Stand not amazed; here is no remedy:

speaker: FORD
text_entry: In love the heavens themselves do guide the state;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Money buys lands, and wives are sold by fate.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I am glad, though you have ta'en a special stand to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: strike at me, that your arrow hath glanced.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Well, what remedy? Fenton, heaven give thee joy!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: What cannot be eschew'd must be embraced.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: When night-dogs run, all sorts of deer are chased.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Well, I will muse no further. Master Fenton,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Heaven give you many, many merry days!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Good husband, let us every one go home,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And laugh this sport o'er by a country fire;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Sir John and all.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Let it be so. Sir John,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: To Master Brook you yet shall hold your word

speaker: FORD
text_entry: For he tonight shall lie with Mistress Ford.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exeunt
